commit_message:
Allow deployers to configure yum fastestmirror

This patch uses the new ``openstack_hosts_enable_yum_fastestmirror``
variable to determine whether yum's fastestmirror plugin should be
enabled.

Depends-On: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
Change-Id: Id340ac48a551081031b14804d376e6e5d744fa0d

commit_message:
Fix a typo in docker_puppet_apply.sh

In change Icf4a64ed76635e39bbb34c3a088c55e1f14fddca we did a refactoring
of the puppet apply commmands into a single script. A typo slipped in
where we set FACTOR_uuid instead of FACTER_uuid

Change-Id: If67d1bbf50d4fdaffa14e197dffc90f5b1577712
Closes-Bug: #1750000

commit_message:
[k8s] allow enabling kubernetes cert manager api

Add a new label 'cert_manager_api' to kubernetes clusters controlling the
enable/disable of the kubernetes certificate manager api.

The same cluster cert/key pair is used by this api. The heat agent is used
to install the key in the master node(s), as this is required for kubernetes
to later sign new certificate requests.

The master template init order is changed so the heat agent is launched
previous to enabling the services - the controller manager requires the CA key
to be locally available before being launched.

Change-Id: Ibf85147316e3a194d8a3f92cbb4ae9ce8e16c98f
Partial-Bug: #1734318

)

-H "Content-Type: application/json" \
-d "$req" \

+    def test_update_cluster_template_replace_labels_success(self):

+        response = self.patch_json('/clustertemplates/%s' %
+                                   cluster_template.uuid,
+                                   [{'path': '/labels',
+                                     'value': '{\'etcd_volume_size\': \'1\'}',
+                                     'op': 'replace'}],
+                                   expect_errors=True)
+        self.assertEqual(200, response.status_int)
+        response = self.get_json('/clustertemplates/%s' %
+                                 self.cluster_template.uuid)
+        self.assertEqual(response['labels'], {'etcd_volume_size': '1'})
+

commit_message:
Now user can update label values in cluster-template

In Magnum Labels are stored in the form of dictionary. previously we
are passing string value directly to store the value of label. Now we
are parsing it and storing it in the form of dictionary.

Change-Id: I4d64da78dc4ed4d5599533b54861b65bce609c28
Closes-Bug: #1638863

commit_message:
Fix exception about loadbalancer_stats

Octavia send loadbalancer statistics through rabbit with type
loadbalancer_stats but neutron_lbaas does not support this type.

Closes-Bug: #1636380
Change-Id: Ib50c8aad8ce4a8393d69f9c271a8cfb7bedac086

commit_message:
Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO. This matches I2c8e4e64c2425cd36903ae9288bd9fee29eef355
which did the same thing for the galera-server role.

Closes-Bug: #1739472
Change-Id: I8f22083a306ba7569148a53af94397c31d90dbac
(cherry picked from commit 934344ab4121e1a42a47b7946ff789672d5281cd)

subject: Testing: mock add_panel_mocks() more flexible
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 16:27:22.000000000', 'message': 'Testing: mock add_panel_mocks() more flexible

Tis commit enhances openstack_dashboard.test.helpers.TestCase
.add_panel_mocks() method to more flexible way.
Now the mock definitions are defined in the test settings and
setUp() in unit tests and selenium tests sets up mocks defined in
the test settings TEST_GLOBAL_MOCKS_ON_PANELS.

This is a preparation for drop of deprecated options (enable_firewall
and enable_vpn). They were marked as deprecated long ago, but they are
still kept just because we need a lot of changes in unit tests if dropped.
By this change, we no longer need to use settings just for testing.

enable_firewall/enable_vpn=False are dropped (default is True)
to confirm this change works well.

Related-Bug: #1687185
Change-Id: I0a5ebcf8d75e704420d3a5af46fde268a59aa9ec
(cherry picked from commit b0a5f30248ac905f676f9ad77f1632430a3acc2e)
'}]
commit_message:
Testing: mock add_panel_mocks() more flexible

Tis commit enhances openstack_dashboard.test.helpers.TestCase
.add_panel_mocks() method to more flexible way.
Now the mock definitions are defined in the test settings and
setUp() in unit tests and selenium tests sets up mocks defined in
the test settings TEST_GLOBAL_MOCKS_ON_PANELS.

This is a preparation for drop of deprecated options (enable_firewall
and enable_vpn). They were marked as deprecated long ago, but they are
still kept just because we need a lot of changes in unit tests if dropped.
By this change, we no longer need to use settings just for testing.

enable_firewall/enable_vpn=False are dropped (default is True)
to confirm this change works well.

Related-Bug: #1687185
Change-Id: I0a5ebcf8d75e704420d3a5af46fde268a59aa9ec
(cherry picked from commit b0a5f30248ac905f676f9ad77f1632430a3acc2e)

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of

commit_message:
Views accessible via url even if user doesn't match policy rules

When a user doesn't match the policy rules of a panel then the panel tab
is removed from the menu of the left, but panel views are still
accessible using directly the url (ex /admin/flavors/).

In most of the case, views won't work correctly because of the lack of
right in the backend, but it may cause trouble when you play with
policies.

I think it could be more elegant to return directly a "You are not
authorized to access this page" from the frontend when user try to
access a view of a panel (via url) without matching the policy rules.

Change-Id: I7bc93fed29568adfc14d5bcadfc8728d3b5cf633
Closes-Bug: #1741051
(cherry picked from commit 3f585d3b1efca1b2379d6c0a80246fd6e5a87640)

commit_message:
Fix overcloud node delete after an upgrade

In fbc435ce167eae2c6ac1070be47ad9065561855b, we stopped passing
'parameters' to stack update call. This is backward incompatible
as the 'parameters' set for the stack before an upgrade would take
precedence over the ones set in 'parameter_defaults' of plan env.

Change-Id: Ia1d823386da687154c433136bf22ae6a0291573d
Closes-Bug: #1749636

commit_message:
VMAX driver - support for manage/unmanage snapshot

VMAX support for managing and unmanaging snapshots.

Change-Id: I0717825dd47fb47c0a58040a13a9da09f6779955
Implements: blueprint vmax-manage-unmanage-snapshot

commit_message:
Add Octavia API endpoint to haproxy

This patch adds an endpoint for Octavia API to haproxy.

Closes-Bug: #1728589

Change-Id: I978b83fa5f3900d2f09c2affc59e90e150a42892

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-08-26 06:50:11.000000000', 'message': "WIP WIP WIP: Add a {{ requires }} context function

This commit introduces metaextract as a new dependency.metaextract
can be use to get metadata via a distutil command from a sdist tarball.

renderspec has now a new --archive switch to set a archive file (tar.gz and
zip are supported)
If --archive is given, the render context has a new {{ requires }} variable
which can be used like:

{% for req in requires() %}
Requires:       {{ req }}
{% endfor %}

The {{ requires }} variable is a list containing the already converted
(depending on the spec-style) pypi name and the version.

TODOs/OpenQuestions:
- about used versions: if a archive file contains a version for a pypi name and
  a requirements file is given, which version should be used?
- splitting requires per subpackage:
  * imo the filtering of requires must be done in the code (not in the template
    via {% if ... %}.
  * introduce a archive.yaml config file which can create filters and add a new
    --archive-config switch to renderspec. The config file could look like:
    ---
    tag1:
    - oslosphinx,sphinx,reno
    tag2:
    - ...

    Then the {{ requires() }} would get extra parameters like 'tag' and
    'tag_modifier' . I.e. {{ requires('tag1', 'include') would create a list
    with only the packages from 'tag1' (if the packages are in the {{ requires }}
    list.
    Not sure if this is a good proposal...
  * a more radical approach would be to define the whole subpackages in a config
    file and create a {{ subpkg }} context function...
  * Any better/other ideas?
- unittests

Change-Id: Ie9325c4be3d8a3d4d1b7e25c7531a9ee2be5d4ae
"}]
commit_message:
WIP WIP WIP: Add a {{ requires }} context function

This commit introduces metaextract as a new dependency.metaextract
can be use to get metadata via a distutil command from a sdist tarball.

renderspec has now a new --archive switch to set a archive file (tar.gz and
zip are supported)
If --archive is given, the render context has a new {{ requires }} variable
which can be used like:

{% for req in requires() %}
Requires:       {{ req }}
{% endfor %}

The {{ requires }} variable is a list containing the already converted
(depending on the spec-style) pypi name and the version.

TODOs/OpenQuestions:
- about used versions: if a archive file contains a version for a pypi name and
  a requirements file is given, which version should be used?
- splitting requires per subpackage:
  * imo the filtering of requires must be done in the code (not in the template
    via {% if ... %}.
  * introduce a archive.yaml config file which can create filters and add a new
    --archive-config switch to renderspec. The config file could look like:
    ---
    tag1:
    - oslosphinx,sphinx,reno
    tag2:
    - ...

    Then the {{ requires() }} would get extra parameters like 'tag' and
    'tag_modifier' . I.e. {{ requires('tag1', 'include') would create a list
    with only the packages from 'tag1' (if the packages are in the {{ requires }}
    list.
    Not sure if this is a good proposal...
  * a more radical approach would be to define the whole subpackages in a config
    file and create a {{ subpkg }} context function...
  * Any better/other ideas?
- unittests

Change-Id: Ie9325c4be3d8a3d4d1b7e25c7531a9ee2be5d4ae

commit_message:
Sync sphinx post jobs

Run sphinx collection jobs for all post jobs - like
we do in playbooks/publish and in sphinx/post-direct.yaml -
only in case of success. No need to try copying those if anything fails.

Change-Id: I1cddee3eef13bf4caac8e6093ca1980849325d70

Do you know log or a reference where this new lines block releasing API reference? I'd like to check the log before merging this if possible."}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-06 05:35:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Sorry for misunderstanding description. These new lines did not block releasing. 

My intent was to use this trivial patch for triggering a publish job.

The api-ref-jobs was added and merged today [1]. So, we merge a patch which changes api-ref directory, and API reference will be published. This patch is for triggering the job. Changes themselves are not important.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540728/'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-02-06 06:57:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Got it. I don't dig into the error yet, but it looks like the api-ref build job fails  because of setting error now.

http://zuul.openstack.org/builds.html?job_name=publish-api-ref
http://logs.openstack.org/29/297533cbb92b57205c177afb1d5b52d4ccc74bec/post/publish-api-ref/c9a16b3/"}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-06 07:42:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Oops. It looks like we have to register service types to service-types-authority[1] and os-service-types[2]. I'll push patches for adding blazar's service type "reservation".

[1] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/service-types-authority/tree/service-types.yaml
[2] https://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/os-service-types/tree/os_service_types/data/service-types.json'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-06 08:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

These patches may fix the problem:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541164/
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541168/'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-02-07 08:08:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Okay, waiting for merging the depending patches.'}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-08 01:46:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let's merge this patch after the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541864/ is merged."}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-15 04:38:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Let's merge this patch after the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/543987/ is merged"}, {'account_id': 23840, 'date': '2018-02-19 00:50:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The dependent patch has been merged.'}, {'account_id': 8878, 'date': '2018-02-19 04:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Install systemd earlier for Ubuntu Bionic

Like we did in https://review.openstack.org/475206 we need to install
systemd sooner because of the new world order of containers.

Change-Id: Ia60d751fee3af6f8d72ad664107acb337360feca
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Skip grenade job on irrelevant changes

We do not need to run grenade for doc-only or similiar changes, skip
those like we skip the devstack jobs.

Placing a -2 here until the spec is merged. Feel free to continue to push new patchsets and solicit review in the meantime. When the spec is merged, feel free to contact me to remove this vote. 

Thanks for doing this work, Naohiro! :)'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-08-10 05:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-08-10 05:57:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Jim, Devananda,

I got fairly firm idea about power state transition, and how to use
node['power_state'] and node['target_power_state'] by POC.
I unified several variable names into three power state variables,
power_state(curr_state), new_state, and target_power_state so as not 
to be confused.
Especially the variable 'target_state' had different semantics between
conductor and ipmitool.


I sorted out the problems that currently I have.

1) how to interrupt the on-going SOFT POWER OFF or INJECT NMI to
   implement cancel or force hard power off?
   Should we change the parameter 'shared=False' of
   task_manager.acquire() to 'shared=True'?

2) how to judge if INJECT NMI has been completed.
   Injecting NMI makes the instance OS reboot.
   We cannot take the same strategy of REBOOT implementation which
   actually involves POWER OFF.
   Should we poll the instance OS via ping, SNMP, or sshd tcp port to
   get the status whether OS is up or down?

For more details, please look at my POC NOTE comment in the source code.

Best regards,
Naohiro"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-10 06:18:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified-1

Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-08-14 14:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-08-14 15:04:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Jim, Devananda, Ramakrishnan,

 > 1) how to interrupt the on-going SOFT POWER OFF or INJECT NMI to
 >    implement cancel or force hard power off?

Patch #4 has a POC implementation of CANCEL_POWER_OFF_SOFT.

I confirmed it works by curl command.

The solution I chose is CSP channels.

Please have a look at the source code.

 > 2) how to judge if INJECT NMI has been completed.

In terms of this issue, I'd like NOT TO IMPLEMENT for ipmitool

driver. Because general BMC is not capable to get OS status.

Each vendor should provide INJECT NMI capability in vendor specific way.

What do you think?

Best regards,
Naohiro"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-14 15:29:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified+1

Jim, Devananda, Lucus, Ramakrishnan,

This POC has been divided into two parts 1) and 2). 

The part 2) depends on the part 1).

 1) Generic power I/F for soft power off and cancel task
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216730/

 2) Enhance ipmitool driver for soft power off and cancel task
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216738/

and then added one more part 3).

The part 3) depends on the part 1).

 3) Enhance iRMC driver for soft power off and cancel task
    https://review.openstack.org/#/c/216743/

This POC will be abandoned if we agreed on this design and implementation.

I'd like to get some core team's feedback in terms of the spec and POC.

Best regards,
Naohiro"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2015-08-29 03:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Verified-1

Hi Tamura-san,

Would you please split this patch into smaller ones ? I think  this is a big feature, including soft reboot/poweroff and nmi. And it impacts several components, ironic conductor, driver, ipmitool. So, maybe smaller patches are easier to review.

Thanks.'}, {'account_id': 13719, 'date': '2015-12-04 01:15:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Naohiro"}, {'account_id': 12356, 'date': '2015-12-17 18:36:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Enhance Power Interface for Soft Power Off and Inject NMI

This patch enhanced the abstract power interface to support soft
reboot, soft power off and inject nmi, and implement the interface
into the concrete ipmitool power class.

Implements: blueprint enhance-power-interface-for-soft-reboot-and-nmi

Change-Id: I4dd8b885715800d57244c7e5c7391a9858400615

commit_message:
Libvirt: Move to lightweight Libvirt 1.3.1 image

This PS moves to use a lightweight libvirt 1.3.1 image based on
ubuntu xenial for used with newton openstack.

Change-Id: I99f64bba7aca3896fc3d32884c3e6f59ff088f79

Fix unicode not define in doc with py3

Under Python 3.6 in Debian Sid, I couldn't build the sphinx doc, and this
patch fixes it. It replaces unicode by six.text_type.

[{'created': '2018-02-13 21:51:24.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I6cc40b4fc473df29c6e3d7844fde6340694d43bb
Partial-Bug: #1741634
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I6cc40b4fc473df29c6e3d7844fde6340694d43bb
Partial-Bug: #1741634

librados2-dev is need to build 'cradox', from gnocchi's ceph
requirements.

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2304baf72d8e7fb25c4e1eb81ed24e06efe56b0b
(cherry picked from commit 2dd95174efbed76003d596b1fcbfeab71b360e70)

In before, if we find inconsistency between container host and

the container and print a warnning. The assuption is that operators

commit_message:
[WIP][Opinion] Skip updating host if inconsistent

In before, if we find inconsistency between container host and
current host, we update the container's host as current host.
However, this logic might not be appropriate because we don't know
the cause of this inconsistency. A better approach is to skip processing
the container and print a warnning. The assuption is that operators
will lookup the warning message and manually resolve the issue.

Change-Id: Icc909d42164b1e903e24d1a84eb5f8edfea724e0

commit_message:
Use tripleomaster as default namespace, not tripleoupstream

docker.io/tripleoupstream is unmaintained.
We should default to tripleomaster which is where master images are
pushed and tagged.

Change-Id: I43ec1359384fd0580069e01eb6a331e1a9abc5ac

We have contributors to submit patches [1] about this. Frankly, it is a bit confused to review those patches since I am not sure what are the rationals of this change. Unfortunately, the commit message doesn't explain anything about the rationals. Moreover, this convention doesn't seem to be widely adapted. I saw devstack is still using 'source' instead of '.' [2]. This makes me feel that using '.' is not really a convention although this change said so.

If anyone can document the rationals of this convention, it will be really helpful.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 22:56:43.000000000', 'message': "Fix small oversight in Python PTI for tests

In the recent change to define an explicit PTI for python testing I made
a small mistake in the tox entry. This is due to me being lazy and just
copy and pasting what I setup for Nova's tox.ini into my governance
change. melwitt recently pointed out that the use of single quotes there
prevents '--' parameters from being interpreted correctly in some cases
(mainly those with spaces). This is because using the quotes around
{posargs} in the tox.ini means the parameters are getting treated as a
single string. This has been fixed in Nova with change
I1c02fd88c3d93b511ff4a6b54b668ebd306481a9 and to make sure this mistake
gets fixed everywhere this commit mirrors that in the PTI document.

Change-Id: I906f643b2714637343a5f9ce2995e7e57c7586bb
"}, {'created': '2018-02-17 22:57:34.000000000', 'message': "Fix small oversight in Python PTI for tests

In the recent change to define an explicit PTI for python testing I made
a small mistake in the tox entry. This is due to me being lazy and just
copy and pasting what I setup for Nova's tox.ini into my governance
change. melwitt recently pointed out that the use of single quotes there
prevents '--' parameters from being interpreted correctly in some cases
(mainly those with spaces). This is because using the quotes around
{posargs} in the tox.ini means the parameters are getting treated as a
single string. This has been fixed in Nova with change
I512a517fa6890b29de24060376b4d7e061dc3add and to make sure this mistake
gets fixed everywhere this commit mirrors that in the PTI document.

Change-Id: I906f643b2714637343a5f9ce2995e7e57c7586bb
"}]
commit_message:
Fix small oversight in Python PTI for tests

In the recent change to define an explicit PTI for python testing I made
a small mistake in the tox entry. This is due to me being lazy and just
copy and pasting what I setup for Nova's tox.ini into my governance
change. melwitt recently pointed out that the use of single quotes there
prevents '--' parameters from being interpreted correctly in some cases
(mainly those with spaces). This is because using the quotes around
{posargs} in the tox.ini means the parameters are getting treated as a
single string. This has been fixed in Nova with change
I512a517fa6890b29de24060376b4d7e061dc3add and to make sure this mistake
gets fixed everywhere this commit mirrors that in the PTI document.

Change-Id: I906f643b2714637343a5f9ce2995e7e57c7586bb

subject: Fix variables in systemd unit file
messages:
[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-12 21:35:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-14 14:59:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-15 12:40:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

These mappings are applied due to the following code path:

main -> magnum_init -> magnum_init_common -> magnum_init_systemd

As in other roles, this abstraction can be removed and simplified dramatically. See the glance role for example:

main -> glance_init_{{ ansible_service_mgr }}.yml

This patch starts that simplification, but it missing some more changes to make it complete.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-17 03:22:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is addressed in the follow-up patch because it would involve too much refactored that is eventually dropped.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-18 11:17:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I would suggest flattening this patch and the follow on patch that refactors things given that this patch is dysfunctional on its own.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-02-18 18:00:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This has been squashed into I3cd735209a0a40d7822377eeb1ca58c95bb51832'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 21:35:36.000000000', 'message': 'Fix variables in systemd unit file

The variable used in the systemd unit file is locally
scoped, this patch updates to use the global variable.

Change-Id: I4d4415a7ab99fe8347905689ac9293cf5744ba7b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix variables in systemd unit file

The variable used in the systemd unit file is locally
scoped, this patch updates to use the global variable.

Change-Id: I4d4415a7ab99fe8347905689ac9293cf5744ba7b

commit_message:
Return stdout data after running the command:

1. e.g. When doing ovn-scale-test; to list the lswitches on northbound
 database on the controller, self.run is not returning the data back.
 Hence this commit fixes it.

Change-Id: I6c5e2c935430641586f204142cb3de00925770c1

subject: Remove version-from-git from javascript publishing playbook
messages:
[{'account_id': 16960, 'date': '2018-02-17 12:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6088, 'date': '2018-02-17 13:19:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Looking through the jobs, it seems there is a bug in "Get commits since tag" in the version-from-git role, in that failed_when only counts failure for an error, but not for a blank result.

Desoite this, nothing in fetch-javascript-tarball appears to consume the variables set in version-from-git, so removing it seems more sensible in this specific case.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2018-02-17 14:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Indeed, when we removed upload-npm from the role, we could have deletes this as well.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-18 16:54:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-17 12:39:31.000000000', 'message': "Remove version-from-git from javascript publishing playbook

The `version-from-git` role doesn't serve a purpose in this playbook,
and seems to cause issues when there are no tags in the project's
repository to get the version from.

Change-Id: I04ed1e172eb795843c9ef58b97611edb4ebb41aa
"}]
commit_message:
Remove version-from-git from javascript publishing playbook

The `version-from-git` role doesn't serve a purpose in this playbook,
and seems to cause issues when there are no tags in the project's
repository to get the version from.

Change-Id: I04ed1e172eb795843c9ef58b97611edb4ebb41aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-04 20:12:21.000000000', 'message': "Dell EMC SC: On None connector terminate_connection unmaps all

On terminate_connection if the connector is None the driver now detatches
the volume from all mapped servers. It leaves connections to remote Storage
Center's so things like replication and live volume continue.

Work in Progress.

commit_message:
Dell EMC SC: On None connector terminate_connection unmaps all

On terminate_connection if the connector is None the driver now detatches
the volume from all mapped servers. It leaves connections to remote Storage
Center's so things like replication and live volume continue.

Change-Id: I205006a3ebab742883018d564e766031024eeb3d

subject: Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.
messages: [{'account_id': 27256, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:48:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:26:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2018-02-18 11:50:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 08:48:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
(cherry picked from commit d15244ab4f2562b46c5fbdb6ccebe18f66e5a579)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
(cherry picked from commit d15244ab4f2562b46c5fbdb6ccebe18f66e5a579)

commit_message:
Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
(cherry picked from commit d15244ab4f2562b46c5fbdb6ccebe18f66e5a579)

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I2304baf72d8e7fb25c4e1eb81ed24e06efe56b0b

tested keystonemiddleware requirement.

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

In addition, this pins Rally's sha.

Change-Id: Ifeb9be248764abd091392a793954173f866ac708
(cherry picked from commit 65383e885d3ac81a246ac8b3b0e36041f6d2d4b8)
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

messages: [{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-02-08 17:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7102, 'date': '2018-02-08 18:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-02-09 15:17:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2018-02-12 03:35:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-02-18 11:24:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit 50897c0b0a5d389f1571d4079e10643ab537fa53'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-08 17:13:12.000000000', 'message': 'Fix invalid json unit test

Recent versions of oslo.serialization have made it possible to dump
exceptions to JSON, which broke a unit test in taskflow that
assumed exceptions were unserializable.  This change switches to an
explicitly unserializable class for that test.

Change-Id: If6d19bc9fcf1f1813cb087d42dc7ba6a61c71b3d
Closes-Bug: 1748241
'}]
commit_message:
Fix invalid json unit test

Recent versions of oslo.serialization have made it possible to dump
exceptions to JSON, which broke a unit test in taskflow that
assumed exceptions were unserializable.  This change switches to an
explicitly unserializable class for that test.

Change-Id: If6d19bc9fcf1f1813cb087d42dc7ba6a61c71b3d
Closes-Bug: 1748241

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Create and run a workflow within a namespace

Add --namespace flag to workflow and execution operations.
Also Add Namespace and Workflow namespace to the tables
the users gets after some cli calls.

Partially-Implements: blueprint create-and-run-workflows-within-a-namespace
Change-Id: Ieb7302870520f5491e94a9bf6759082e2aa4a450

subject: Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 18:20:46.000000000', 'message': "Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: Ic499df87f5bfdf602b4739ebd0681d2dd81285cb
(cherry picked from commit 273fd8a473fbee990b32f9d0c78346e36600f182)

commit_message:
Pass mistral execution argument by name

A recent released change added a positional argument where we don't
expect it. It works around it.

Closes-Bug: #1749645
Change-Id: I4e9f4bb726c3461d17b2e22679377e262cd13462

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I35277bfa2de254337854c6058e32f91ac1d621c8

'deployment' hosts don't need api interface. Previous fix checked

is not correct because uses can create own groups and the check

groups that don't need api_interface.

commit_message:
Don't check api_interface for 'deployment' group

'deployment' hosts don't need api interface. Previous fix checked
if hosts belong global groups like [compute] or [control] which
is not correct because uses can create own groups and the check
won't work there at all. Here the logic is reversed - we blacklist
groups that don't need api_interface.

Change-Id: Ibaa94004016ba41a2ae5700c48522e254c6ee239
Closes-Bug: #1732846

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-15 20:10:34.000000000', 'message': 'detach instance volumes when VM creation fails

If the boot-volume creation fails, the data volume is left in state "in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state". The user can't detach the volume because of the server's error state. They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently attached to a server that no longer exists.

Change-Id: I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0
Closes-bug: #1633249

commit_message:
Detach volumes when VM creation fails

If the boot-volume creation fails, the data volume is left in state
"in-use", attached to the server which is now in "error" state.
The user can't detach the volume because of the server's error state.

They can delete the server, which then leaves the volume apparently
attached to a server that no longer exists, which is being fixed
separately: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/340614/

The only way out of this is to ask an administrator to reset the state of
the data volume (this option is not available to regular users by
default policy).

This change fixes the problem in the compute service such that
when the creation fails, compute manager detaches the created volumes
before putting the VM into error state. Then you can delete the instance
without care about attached volumes.

Change-Id: I8b1c05317734e14ea73dc868941351bb31210bf0
Closes-bug: #1633249

commit_message:
docker: don't override horizon::vhost_extra_params

horizon::vhost_extra_params is already configured in
puppet/services/horizon.yaml, and users can change the value with
HorizonVhostExtraParams parameter.

Docker deployments didn't have HorizonVhostExtraParams taken in account
since we were overriding with Hiera. This patch fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1749627
Change-Id: I77f1312112c7f613d795242060709082ef72f150
(cherry picked from commit 995cf7105759689d72b1664726ab02a69fe1864d)

commit_message:
Add --dns-domain to 'network create' and 'network set'

The neutron client supports --dns-domain on both network
create and update, for some reason the openstack client
doesn't, so let's update it.

Change-Id: I7146301530278fbab8db501dfc81975244c16066

@James, is it possible to make the module idempotent somehow ? I'm not familiar enough with the machinery involved, but either on the client side (check if something has already been submitted) or on the server side (discarding duplicate data) ?

commit_message:
Try 3 times to submit results to logstash.o.o

If we are not able to connect to logstash gearman server, try again (3
times) before we fail.

This is to help mitigate:

  NoConnectedServersError('No connected Gearman servers',)

some jobs are seeing.

Change-Id: Ic875328a9af453ed3e8ffedf01943808fb94da44
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Unit tests: Fix broken Monasca client test

The context is held by a weak reference in the ClientPlugin, so don't let
it go out of scope in the caller.

This test was added by 36e53d3c2b973c45a4dc7af7af39b0110437de48.

Change-Id: I6a313970f1c0604e94d008eb12aeaa94da1d25c4
Closes-Bug: #1750024
(cherry picked from commit 6b99a54cbe02a1859d97475ea6681df2b266b6e1)

commit_message:
docker: don't override horizon::vhost_extra_params

horizon::vhost_extra_params is already configured in
puppet/services/horizon.yaml, and users can change the value with
HorizonVhostExtraParams parameter.

Docker deployments didn't have HorizonVhostExtraParams taken in account
since we were overriding with Hiera. This patch fix it.

Closes-Bug: #1749627
Change-Id: I77f1312112c7f613d795242060709082ef72f150

subject: Allow to disable DNS server announcement per subnet
messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:30:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:18:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nUnfortunately this is a change in behavior, so doesn't meet the criteria for the stable branches."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-02-17 22:09:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 14:30:50.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to disable DNS server announcement per subnet

Currently there is no way to have DHCP agents not announce DNS servers
for a subnet. The current behaviour when the dns_nameservers option is
set to '0.0.0.0' is that each agent will only announce itself instead of
announcing the list of all dhcp agents for that subnet, which seems not
too useful. So we redefine the meaning of this option to instruct the
DHCP agent to not announce any DNS server in that case.

Actually, going back to square one, it would be more natural to swap the
meaning of "option unset" and "option 0.0.0.0", but that would change
the default behaviour for all existing installation and thus does not
seem feasible.

Change-Id: I32d943360162c483ac1364100a21ab56b13517fb
Closes-Bug: 1311040
(cherry picked from commit 584b7561c162ec461e5c6a8dff5c012402cac5e0)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to disable DNS server announcement per subnet

Currently there is no way to have DHCP agents not announce DNS servers
for a subnet. The current behaviour when the dns_nameservers option is
set to '0.0.0.0' is that each agent will only announce itself instead of
announcing the list of all dhcp agents for that subnet, which seems not
too useful. So we redefine the meaning of this option to instruct the
DHCP agent to not announce any DNS server in that case.

Actually, going back to square one, it would be more natural to swap the
meaning of "option unset" and "option 0.0.0.0", but that would change
the default behaviour for all existing installation and thus does not
seem feasible.

Change-Id: I32d943360162c483ac1364100a21ab56b13517fb
Closes-Bug: 1311040
(cherry picked from commit 584b7561c162ec461e5c6a8dff5c012402cac5e0)

commit_message:
Add non-production ceph defaults to low-memory-usage.yaml

Ceph Luminous does not create a pool if the pg_number,
pool size, and mon_max_pg_per_osd are outside of Ceph
recomended practice for production clusters. TripleO
development environments which use low-memory-usage.yaml
may not meet this criteria and fail a deployment with
Luminous unless the defaults for these values are overriden
as in this change.

Change-Id: I12ee495b780f29fc098c5c3bd57c46fd946146ae
Closes-Bug: #1749544

[{'created': '2018-02-12 20:45:21.000000000', 'message': "Always pass device_owner to _ipam_get_subnets()

There was one code path where the existing device_owner
value, which is used for subnet selection when service_type's
are in use was not passed to _imap_get_subnets().  This could
trigger one of two exceptions - HostNotCompatibleWithFixedIps()
or IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() depending
on the environment.  Pass it along if known.

Also update the IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet
exception to print the network_id and service_type values since
it could aid in debugging the problem quicker.

Change-Id: Ic13901b92cac05e8ddf1092b66aa5bcc5623fa8a
Closes-bug: #1637366
"}]
commit_message:
Always pass device_owner to _ipam_get_subnets()

There was one code path where the existing device_owner
value, which is used for subnet selection when service_type's
are in use was not passed to _imap_get_subnets().  This could
trigger one of two exceptions - HostNotCompatibleWithFixedIps()
or IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet() depending
on the environment.  Pass it along if known.

Also update the IpAddressGenerationFailureNoMatchingSubnet
exception to print the network_id and service_type values since
it could aid in debugging the problem quicker.

Change-Id: Ic13901b92cac05e8ddf1092b66aa5bcc5623fa8a
Closes-bug: #1637366

commit_message:
Process conntrack updates in worker threads

With a large number of instances and/or security group rules,
conntrack updates when ports are removed or rules are changed
can take a long time to process.  By enqueuing these to a set
or worker threads, the agent can continue with other work while
they are processed in the background.

This is a change in behavior in the agent since it could
program a new set of security group rules before all existing
conntrack entries are deleted, but since the iptables or OVSfw
NAT rules will have been removed, it should not pose a
security issue.

Change-Id: Ibf858c7fdf7a822a30e4a0c4722d70fd272741b6
Closes-bug: #1745468

commit_message:
Use host_vars for wheel builds

No need to use magic names since we now have host_vars, instead set
wheel_python explicitly.

Remove TODO comment.

Change-Id: I5051a32d843b106b013b94d57fd24b63896b741a

commit_message:
Unit tests: Fix broken Monasca client test

The context is held by a weak reference in the ClientPlugin, so don't let
it go out of scope in the caller.

This test was added by 36e53d3c2b973c45a4dc7af7af39b0110437de48.

Change-Id: I6a313970f1c0604e94d008eb12aeaa94da1d25c4
Closes-Bug: #1750024

Seems to work fine other than the issues that need to be sorted out with the functional envs.

Result with this patch:

$ tox -epy27 nova.tests.unit.compute
...
======
Totals
======
Ran: 2117 tests in 92.0000 sec.

Result without this patch:

$ tox -epy27 nova.tests.unit.compute
...
======
Totals
======
Ran: 2117 tests in 91.0000 sec.'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-02-17 03:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

lol, so after a lot of digging and adding a bunch of print statements to the code, I figured out that '--group-regex=nova\\.tests\\.functional\\.api\\.openstack\\.placement\\.test_placement_api(?:\\.|_)([^_]+)' was being treated as a regex in the functional jobs. This is because the cli argument is 'group_regex' not 'group-regex' in stestr<=1.1.0. This has been fixed in stestr master with: https://github.com/mtreinish/stestr/commit/93500d00422ba8d7ad93d8fcf5b2e06ea4963cbe There should be a release which will include that soon, I just have one last feature to land and then some prerelease testing before pushing it out. But in the mean time we can just fix the argument to be the correct one to get around this.

The reason this works with the quotes in the current definition is because '' is being passed in if there are no posargs provided and regexes are OR'ed for matches. So there was a regex that matched everything and a regex which matched none meaning the union of those sets is everything. The interesting thing this points out is that the group_regex does nothing today, and yet the functional tests still worked without any issues. I wonder if we really need it anymore. But that's something we can investigate in the future (and we'll need to ask cdent about too)"}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2018-02-17 03:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-02-17 04:18:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Build succeeded.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 22:26:27.000000000', 'message': "Remove single quotes from posargs on stestr run commands

This commit removes the single quotes from all the stestr run commands
in the tox.ini. These were originally added as a workaround from the
ostestr days to ensure people could run a subset of tests with a regex
like:

  tox -epy27 regex

With the switch to stestr this is no longer needed because stestr treats
extra arguments as a filter regex. Quoting the posargs has a negative
effect because '--' parameters are treated as a string on input instead
of a parameter.

Change-Id: I512a517fa6890b29de24060376b4d7e061dc3add
"}, {'created': '2018-02-17 03:08:54.000000000', 'message': "Remove single quotes from posargs on stestr run commands

This commit removes the single quotes from all the stestr run commands
in the tox.ini. These were originally added as a workaround from the
ostestr days to ensure people could run a subset of tests with a regex
like:

  tox -epy27 regex

With the switch to stestr this is no longer needed because stestr treats
extra arguments as a filter regex. Quoting the posargs has a negative
effect because '--' parameters are treated as a string on input instead
of a parameter.

Fixing this also uncovered another issue in the stestr commands for the
functional jobs. The CLI arg for stestr versions <=1.1.0 is
--group_regex not --group-regex. This commit fixes this to make those
jobs pass without the quotes.

Change-Id: I512a517fa6890b29de24060376b4d7e061dc3add
"}]
commit_message:
Remove single quotes from posargs on stestr run commands

This commit removes the single quotes from all the stestr run commands
in the tox.ini. These were originally added as a workaround from the
ostestr days to ensure people could run a subset of tests with a regex
like:

  tox -epy27 regex

With the switch to stestr this is no longer needed because stestr treats
extra arguments as a filter regex. Quoting the posargs has a negative
effect because '--' parameters are treated as a string on input instead
of a parameter.

Fixing this also uncovered another issue in the stestr commands for the
functional jobs. The CLI arg for stestr versions <=1.1.0 is
--group_regex not --group-regex. This commit fixes this to make those
jobs pass without the quotes.

commit_message:
Fix row/column nesting

The row entry in each section is before the community column - but it
seems like the intent is actually for it to be a row for each entry.

Change-Id: I7548ec82062071286280bcbda6b0fa2d4bbe7b76

subject: Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-02-17 13:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-14 13:41:54.000000000', 'message': "Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I5715f4067c7c1051f7fdf43cd48a4c6535bc4ebd
"}]
commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: I5715f4067c7c1051f7fdf43cd48a4c6535bc4ebd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-02 11:54:29.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Implement SRDF Metro feature

SRDF/Metro allows a remotely replicated (SRDF) secondary device
to be read/write accessible to the host, taking on the external
identity of the primary device (geometry, device WWN, and so on).
Both the primary and secondary devices may then appear as a single
virtual device across the two SRDF paired arrays. With both devices
being accessible, the host can read and write to both primary and
secondary devices, with SRDF/Metro ensuring each copy remains current
and consistent, addressing any write conflicts which may occur.
This patch adds this functionality to the VMAX cinder driver.

Change-Id: Ib31763ea5759f7f9c0d2e2db68ba3820188245db
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmax-replication-enhancements

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Implement SRDF Metro feature

SRDF/Metro allows a remotely replicated (SRDF) secondary device
to be read/write accessible to the host, taking on the external
identity of the primary device (geometry, device WWN, and so on).
Both the primary and secondary devices may then appear as a single
virtual device across the two SRDF paired arrays. With both devices
being accessible, the host can read and write to both primary and
secondary devices, with SRDF/Metro ensuring each copy remains current
and consistent, addressing any write conflicts which may occur.
This patch adds this functionality to the VMAX cinder driver.

Change-Id: Ib31763ea5759f7f9c0d2e2db68ba3820188245db
Partially-Implements: blueprint vmax-replication-enhancements

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

commit_message:
docs: Update help text for encryption provider

The volume encryption provider no longer uses class names.
Instead, 'luks' and 'plain' are used. This patch updates
the help text for the volume encryption provider to use
the new encryption provider format constants.

Change-Id: I582b239d9de86aa1f1f5e55d4576cc65d33e74a7

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie7869e723f56fe6b8af1b3b90704d1982412e28d

commit_message:
Add alias for zaqar messaging service

Just confirmed with Zaqar team that the official service name for Zaqar
is 'messaging'. When trying to identify services supported by SDK, we
need to know that 'messaging' is the same thing as 'message' which has
an implementation in SDK.

Depends-On: Ifaef01ec5f348b7bd7466ec6c662a204d78af2d3
Change-Id: I3dc6e0b08908e07d5071ffede7be6db29d38bdcf
Closes-Bug: #1747904

commit_message:
mistral-executor: mount /var/lib/mistral

When containerizing mistral-executor, we need to mount /var/lib/mistral so
our operators can get the config-download logs when the undercloud is
containerized and config-download is used to deploy the overcloud.

To help our operators, we also create /var/lib/mistral/readme.txt so
they know where to find the config-download data.

Change-Id: I8d31d5fec2721c6e4f82b1ad2169a7635cb57600
Closes-Bug: #1749823

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Id24b1c6b5f3f8c26e4bbbf155f196029bed4141e
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Fix the freezer-agent.log path for doc

the freezer-agent service's log is 
/var/log/freezer-agent/freezer-agent.log [0] or ~/.freezer/freezer.log
[1], rather than /var/log/freezer.log

[0]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L582
[1]: https://github.com/openstack/freezer/blob/master/freezer/common/config.py#L589

Change-Id: I21c5dba4c551646a6f997d28257dab12de0ed973

commit_message:
Restart only when needed

The role currently always restarts Magnum at the end
of every run which is not ideal.

This patch removes the restart at every run and adds
a notify for configuration changes.

Change-Id: Ia47d9983598598b5550d623df78aae616d8948a4

subject: Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:12:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-16 18:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-17 02:05:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 15:10:05.000000000', 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

This also avoids updating the blacklist during a preview, which the
previous code erroneously did.

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Closes-Bug: #1749426
(cherry picked from commit 32ec5141de1a8017ccfddc5dccf114deff8271ba)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

This also avoids updating the blacklist during a preview, which the
previous code erroneously did.

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
Closes-Bug: #1749426
(cherry picked from commit 32ec5141de1a8017ccfddc5dccf114deff8271ba)

subject: Don't add required attribute to html form fields
messages: [{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-01-16 19:09:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 11885, 'date': '2018-02-17 04:31:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-16 19:09:55.000000000', 'message': 'Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109
(cherry picked from commit 1fa9ae26cc6006f8ee94fabddb7fea171adee55d)
'}]
commit_message:
Don't add required attribute to html form fields

In Django 1.10 a new Form property was introduced, defaulting to True,
which enabled HTML form validation for fields marked "required" in
Django. This changed old behavior, which was that required fields were
only validated server-side. This patch restores old behavior by setting
use_required_attribute to False for the inherited AuthenticationForm.

This problem arose because when WebSSO is enabled and a
non-keystone-credentials authentication method is selected from the
dropdown list, the now-hidden username and password fields are still
marked "required" and still validated client-side, even though they are
invisible to the user and cannot be filled in. It would be nice to fix
the javascript to properly turn the "required" attribute on or off
depending on what authentication method is selected and whether the
"required" fields are even visible, but for now this just restores the
behavior we had before Djanto 1.10.

Change-Id: I3e798a2288d9c33396b40a86b07ea8c163d3b525
Closes-bug: #1703109
(cherry picked from commit 1fa9ae26cc6006f8ee94fabddb7fea171adee55d)

commit_message:
Unfreeze Rocky

This patch unfreezes all the roles to the master branch,
updates all the OpenStack Service SHA's for Rocky, and
updates the appropriate python requirements pins.

Change-Id: Iccfdb575774cdba93772c82a580cd815b58a4625

commit_message:
Update the Tempest plugin to point towards the new plugin

The Magnum service has split it's tests for Tempest in a seperate
repo so this patch updates it.

This patch also fixes the lint issue to use the systemd module
reload feature instead of a command.

Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
Closes-Bug: #1747607
Depends-On: I5f1ecb71c6125c29d6487bef6c2be215c1b561c1
Change-Id: Ia4e323eda453ae3e8dacf3dcf14d175e00727b4f

commit_message:
Add librados2-dev to distro package list

librados2-dev is need to build 'cradox', from gnocchi's ceph
requirements.

The package lists have also been alphabetized.

A linting error in tests was corrected to unblock the gates.

Change-Id: I91b579ff478c02f40fb1573b433735a6a3794e2b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:14:43.000000000', 'message': 'Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)
'}]
commit_message:
Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd
(cherry picked from commit 0e5cedca606eb3f365a516078021403070b42c2c)

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

Change-Id: Ie1fec1452c308e0f003898ddd70262fb3c64aeee

updates it.

commit_message:
Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

We stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back
but the requirement remained in requirements.txt. This patch
removes it.

Change-Id: I7cfce70bbf630d1cf15fcc358bdba3371c03ceee
(cherry picked from commit c834eb9a8187d288025d7c31591c0e340e3e0507)

commit_message:
Remove pycrypto from requirements.txt

We stopped using pycrypto for secrets generation a while back
but the requirement remained in requirements.txt. This patch
removes it.

Change-Id: I7cfce70bbf630d1cf15fcc358bdba3371c03ceee
(cherry picked from commit c834eb9a8187d288025d7c31591c0e340e3e0507)

and published the EOL tag, the role should default
to using it.

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Ife01f535406b8169ce8aaf9e1cc3b942e8519bd9
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 789991734e673f5cc1a01c46c93f827af7e5becc)

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I017a5d979fd70f086860b0604b4cec4d8891b1ba
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit c15254988ecb01483278128465c8cc435fd72c10)

commit_message:
Images: Move default to LOCI and Kolla newton gate

This PS moves the default image in OSH for most services to use LOCI
and also provides a Kolla gate for newton openstack.

Change-Id: Ice6cb9f89bc3ce6e8280e580d215aedda9e71904

commit_message:
DO NOT REVIEW - Iptables workaround for docker

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545209/ does't work yet, I need this
workaround in CI to make progress on testing containerized undercloud.

Meanwhile, I'll make https://review.openstack.org/#/c/545209/4 working
in my env and fix the issue I have with neutron_api firewall rules.

Change-Id: I97088e766a150c546f3785e1203d2078779836d3

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id08486ce5af2dfb1b747a911e26c8a7d79704ffa
(cherry picked from commit bfce71bd2f9542745959bdf59c8246cc09e80671)

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

On top of this, the upgrade is modified to take the latest
changes in ops upgrade testing into consideration.

Change-Id: I6652147f2acacc9ac59d70998f541942ead62041

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

To prevent having a larger patch that includes the removal
of CloudWatch, this commit just ensure cloudwatch isn't tested
during the heat functional test.

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: I7407c65f5b3322a34905f529f1adc7cac343357e
(cherry picked from commit cd8659007850b075be9628816f567c27f0e256e7)

Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The

host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

messages:
[{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-15 20:59:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-02-15 21:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Thanks Monty! Seems to fix the problem for me in my liberty cloud.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-15 22:45:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2018-02-17 00:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

squashed in to "honor service type aliases"'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 20:59:27.000000000', 'message': "Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

This is why we can't have nice things.

Change-Id: Ib13826b7cee65f9b08920af8e2d66622db639b44
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 22:45:25.000000000', 'message': "Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

This is why we can't have nice things.

Change-Id: Ib13826b7cee65f9b08920af8e2d66622db639b44
"}]
commit_message:
Handle liberty-era neutron

We had a workaround for this in the shade code, but it really should
have been in the CloudRegion code.

The underlying issue here is that neutron didn't have a version
discovery document, and also that neutronclient just hard-coded an
append of v2.0 to the end of the endpoint in the catalog. There's really
no way around also doing an append - but we can do our best to not do
the append unless we need to.

This is why we can't have nice things.

Change-Id: Ib13826b7cee65f9b08920af8e2d66622db639b44

subject: Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 00:22:27.000000000', 'message': 'Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder

Discovery for block-storage is tricky due to project_ids being needed in
the URL still, but the unversioned endpoint in the catalog having no
project_id. Nobody is actually using block-storage yet, so hack it for
the moment until we can figure out a proper solution.

Change-Id: I46d1a88393f70b82075ff3a2f1535c217a8d0a79
'}]
commit_message:
Work around discovery being a bit messy for cinder

Discovery for block-storage is tricky due to project_ids being needed in
the URL still, but the unversioned endpoint in the catalog having no
project_id. Nobody is actually using block-storage yet, so hack it for
the moment until we can figure out a proper solution.

Change-Id: I46d1a88393f70b82075ff3a2f1535c217a8d0a79

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: Ieb683b8f8f10b93582f71e94c5c4249ff2ab3108
(cherry picked from commit 2817b2efdc254dcd4b018a04c1525bbaf83e1cd8)

commit_message:
Fix for lookup and get_url occuring in different places

We use an SSH bastion host which we do our deployment through. The
deployment host doesn't have direct access to the same network as the
host. As a result the venv local checksum lookup fails.

I have described this here:

https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-ansible/+bug/1689283

This is a simple fix for this problem, assuming everything is good it
will need repeating in multiple places in the code base.

Change-Id: Iee5666ffc2376174a64e5686675f967c590914d2
(cherry picked from commit 1d7630eb5921298704d8b1a2e1a06e4bae6b6a6e)

subject: Only show errors when copying logs
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:31:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 19:37:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-02-16 23:11:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:31:26.000000000', 'message': 'Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2
'}]
commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:56:15.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Further clarify placement aggregates

Following up on the comments at [1], provide further disambiguation and
clarity on the difference between placement aggregates and nova host
aggregates, with some illustrative examples that include where the
former may be used to represent the latter (as is being proposed via
[2]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539033/1/placement-api-ref/source/aggregates.inc@14
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates

Change-Id: I53588fca311992f885c4157591232a864b6a86b1
'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Further clarify placement aggregates

Following up on the comments at [1], provide further disambiguation and
clarity on the difference between placement aggregates and nova host
aggregates, with some illustrative examples that include where the
former may be used to represent the latter (as is being proposed via
[2]).

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/539033/1/placement-api-ref/source/aggregates.inc@14
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/q/bp/placement-mirror-host-aggregates

Change-Id: I53588fca311992f885c4157591232a864b6a86b1

subject: Remove db api and tables for CloudWatch
messages:
[{'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-21 08:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-21 08:37:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-21 09:08:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-22 05:43:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-24 04:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-25 05:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-25 16:32:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-01-28 04:07:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-01-29 08:51:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2018-01-30 18:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-01 22:18:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Workflow-1 -Code-Review

Actually, now that I think about it, we should't drop the DB tables in Queens because the DB migrations run *before* the upgrade. In theory there may be people still running the service in Pike (hopefully not though), and the DB migration would break them.

I think we should delay the DB migration part of the patch to Rocky."}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-02 03:44:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I think we should delay the DB migration part of the patch to Rocky.

We can surely do that if we want. As no one responded to our ML thread and it's deprecated since long, I don't think there is lot of risk in doing it now though."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-02 15:44:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Yeah, I agree there's not a big risk. cloudwatch doesn't even work when you have multiple engines, so it's been useless since at least juno iirc. OTOH it doesn't cost us anything to do the DB migration later -  we can still get rid of all the code that uses it (model & db API) if we want - and it is in line with our stated policy."}, {'account_id': 12404, 'date': '2018-02-05 09:47:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-16 20:45:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Queens has branched.'}]

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: I8550096d44912a6ae534fa18d1ea1143dcb12d0b

commit_message:
reproducer: use OS_PROJECT_NAME instead of deprecated OS_TENANT_NAME

"Tenant" notion is an old keystone v2 thing that has been replaced for a
while by "Project", we should use OS_PROJECT_NAME instead of
OS_TENANT_NAME.

OS_PROJECT_NAME works fine with keystone v2 AND keystone v3.

Change-Id: I5e270a36f8b0a823a7752f7fada2fbcd8cc8afdc

[{'created': '2018-02-16 22:02:53.000000000', 'message': "Set post-timeout value to half an hour on base jobs

Jobs now have two timeout values. A regular timeout for the bulk of the
job then a timeout for post run playbooks. Set the post run playbook
timeout to half an hour which should be plenty for any post run playbook
by default.

If this isn't sufficient because jobs are uploading large artifacts they
can increase their timeout in their jobs explicitly.

Change-Id: I2a9b67d6d1fbc3b1b8d44140e13351241ca31143
"}]
commit_message:
Set post-timeout value to half an hour on base jobs

Jobs now have two timeout values. A regular timeout for the bulk of the
job then a timeout for post run playbooks. Set the post run playbook
timeout to half an hour which should be plenty for any post run playbook
by default.

If this isn't sufficient because jobs are uploading large artifacts they
can increase their timeout in their jobs explicitly.

Change-Id: I2a9b67d6d1fbc3b1b8d44140e13351241ca31143
