revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-09 15:57:49.000000000', 'message': 'VMAX driver - Enable CHAP authentication for vmax backend

This integrates Initiator (one way) CHAP authentication functionality into the
VMAX backend. Prior discovery should have been established. When an initiator
tries to manually connect to the array that is CHAP enabled,
use_chap_auth=True, chap_username and chap_password must be set in the
backend configuration

Change-Id: I037ae494eeb234fe2285b3635d24ee8c5226b9bc

commit_message:
VMAX driver - Enable CHAP authentication for vmax backend

This integrates Initiator (one way) CHAP authentication functionality into the
VMAX backend. Prior discovery should have been established. When an initiator
tries to manually connect to the array that is CHAP enabled,
use_chap_auth=True, chap_username and chap_password must be set in the
backend configuration

Change-Id: I037ae494eeb234fe2285b3635d24ee8c5226b9bc
Implements: blueprint vmax-iscsi-chap-authentication

This should change them.

Looks like Mel's cross-cell service version check fixes the issue in the API, I'm not seeing the error message anymore. The reason a test failed is because we still call os-initialize_connection in the case that we boot from volume with a volume snapshot (or image, or blank) where nova has to create the volume:

http://logs.openstack.org/92/540992/4/check/tempest-full/4183bda/controller/logs/screen-n-api.txt.gz#_Feb_06_02_57_54_039152

http://logs.openstack.org/92/540992/4/check/tempest-full/4183bda/controller/logs/screen-n-cpu.txt.gz?level=TRACE#_Feb_06_02_57_59_182028"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-06 19:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-02-06 20:36:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only zvm: recheck in the comment. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-13876 : SUCCESS in 48m 10s'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-02-07 00:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with check hyper-v

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/540992/5/ : FAILURE in 4h 14m 51s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-02-16 21:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Update monasca testing overrides

The monasca_git_install_branch is already defined in defaults,
and the override of it causes some confusion and is unnecessary.

The tests used have moved to a different repository.

Change-Id: Ie87b40e438a713a7cc88d2a4a53831f023586f7a

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:30:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/queens.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:31:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 19:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:30:59.000000000', 'message': 'Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2
'}]
commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Only show errors when copying logs

When copying the logs, the log shows all the files copied
which is unnecessary and just consumes console log space.

In this patch we do not show all the files copied, but we
still show errors which is informative enough  without
wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

commit_message:
Point to Queens instead of master

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

This also backports [1] to ensure only the required storage drivers
are used.

[1]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542898/4
Change-Id: Ibfa1611ca203525d6b278f8aeb5ef41aca048a6a

kubernetes does clustering for us and with persistent robust PVs
clustering of mariadb isn't useful for most people by default

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ie29a829c0f0a488549eb80a6170ca265366cc9ec

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:07:55.000000000', 'message': "Override root object count with actual listing length when possible

When constructing a container listing from shards' listings, the
actual listing length may different from the root container's object
count if shard containers have not updated the root stats.

Before, the X-Container-Object-Count returned to the client was always
the value returned by the root container. With this patch that value
is overridden *when appropriate* by the actual listing length.  This
is only appropriate when the listing is unconstrained (no marker etc.)
and does not get capped by the listng length limit.  In practice this
will only apply to shrinking sharded containers, but also to test
conditions where this patch should make listing results more
predictable.

Change-Id: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728
"}, {'created': '2018-02-16 16:52:10.000000000', 'message': "Override root object count with actual listing length when possible

When constructing a container listing from shards' listings, the
actual listing length may different from the root container's object

Before, the X-Container-Object-Count returned to the client was always
the value returned by the root container. With this patch that value
is overridden *when appropriate* by the actual listing length.  This
is only appropriate when the listing is unconstrained (no marker etc.)
and does not get capped by the listng length limit.  In practice this
will only apply to shrinking sharded containers, but also to test
conditions where this patch should make listing results more
predictable.

Change-Id: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728
"}]
commit_message:
Override root object count with actual listing length when possible

When constructing a container listing from shards' listings, the
actual listing length may different from the root container's object
count if shard containers have not updated the root stats.

Before, the X-Container-Object-Count returned to the client was always
the value returned by the root container. With this patch that value
is overridden *when appropriate* by the actual listing length.  This
is only appropriate when the listing is unconstrained (no marker etc.)
and does not get capped by the listng length limit.  In practice this
will only apply to shrinking sharded containers, but also to test
conditions where this patch should make listing results more
predictable.

Change-Id: Ia91fbeefde37ea64bf50220636522f3dc64a6728

 Config option key_manager.api_class is deprecated.
Use option key_manager.backend instead.

it's because nova use castellan and castellan uses
https://github.com/openstack/castellan/blob/master/castellan/key_manager/__init__.py#L25

so nova need to follow the change to avoid the warning.

"}]
commit_message:
Fix warn api_class is deprecated, use backend

See a warning like
 Config option key_manager.api_class is deprecated.
Use option key_manager.backend instead.

it's because nova use castellan and castellan uses
https://github.com/openstack/castellan/blob/master/castellan/key_manager/__init__.py#L25

so nova need to follow the change to avoid the warning.

Change-Id: Ibfdb087e6421d55ceefd805f67550e668c86be61

commit_message:
Only log during pop retry phase

Retry filter reports confusing log 'Re-scheduling is disabled'
now even if the retry attempts > 0 , this is because we populate
retry after calling scheduling function in conductor, this patch
only log the info when needed in populate function.

Change-Id: I67b3650564503061480b439d6265a3b4f45ac16c
Closes-Bug: 1738876

subject: Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 18:00:23.000000000', 'message': 'Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts

Without these, users will encounter messages like "Unable to load
native-hadoop library for your platform...", which is no fun at all.

For posterity's sake, you can note that this artifact was built by
following the instructions given in the README of the "hadoop" element
in SIE, with the additional note that newer Linux distros do not
package protobuf 2.5.0 which must be built from source instead.

Change-Id: I51a9343bd5804254e36b4d52334644ac6f3f8cef
'}]
commit_message:
Add Hadoop 2.8.2 native libs to common artifacts

Without these, users will encounter messages like "Unable to load
native-hadoop library for your platform...", which is no fun at all.

For posterity's sake, you can note that this artifact was built by
following the instructions given in the README of the "hadoop" element
in SIE, with the additional note that newer Linux distros do not
package protobuf 2.5.0 which must be built from source instead.

Change-Id: I51a9343bd5804254e36b4d52334644ac6f3f8cef

messages: [{'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:34:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:49:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nunit test is failing.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:15:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:29:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 8213, 'date': '2018-02-16 16:00:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8543, 'date': '2018-02-16 19:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 13:34:26.000000000', 'message': 'Cluster driver: Blacklist iSCSI/FC volume drivers

There are critical known issues related to the cluster driver and
passthrough disks.

When an instance is failed over, the instance attached volumes need
to be accessible on the destination host. This will not happen
transparently for such disks, for which reason the instance may
bounce between a few nodes and then end up in error state,
basically defeating the purpose of the cluster driver.

This change ensures that the Hyper-V Cluster driver rejects
iSCSI/FC Cinder volumes, raising an error that describes possible
alternatives.

Change-Id: I231b51c648e1349fcb8df4cd818b2d2887a55d69

Change-Id: I231b51c648e1349fcb8df4cd818b2d2887a55d69

commit_message:
Cluster driver: Blacklist iSCSI/FC volume drivers

There are critical known issues related to the cluster driver and
passthrough disks.

When an instance is failed over, the instance attached volumes need
to be accessible on the destination host. This will not happen
transparently for such disks, for which reason the instance may
bounce between a few nodes and then end up in error state,
basically defeating the purpose of the cluster driver.

This change ensures that the Hyper-V Cluster driver rejects
iSCSI/FC Cinder volumes, raising an error that describes possible
alternatives.

Closes-Bug: #1749958

Change-Id: I231b51c648e1349fcb8df4cd818b2d2887a55d69

docs: Update Cinder volume usage section

This change documents how to identify Cinder volumes from within
the guets as well as online resize limitations.

Change-Id: I725e958ae85353acdf1a1eb110f1a03c3629f0b2

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Id08486ce5af2dfb1b747a911e26c8a7d79704ffa

commit_message:
tests: test-nova-upgrades.sh: Remove the exit trap

We are already collecting logs as part of the post-run playbook so we
don't need to do that as part of the exit trap. This avoid collecting
and compressing the logs twice.

Change-Id: I03ad2ae6ded9e13052980694d1122169c1374bb0
(cherry picked from commit 4ff28dc3619374d054e3fc849aafc539841557ae)

commit_message:
If debug is enabled, provide verbose output for host discovery

In order to aid debugging, we add the '--verbose' CLI option to
the discovery command. This gives us a little more information
to work with when looking through the logs.

Change-Id: I194a1b20ceba4def8cac9591ef9bf0abf0b7f77f
(cherry picked from commit ec4c2624783328dc755a5090e4843997e630dc3e)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-02 10:13:27.000000000', 'message': 'Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)
'}, {'created': '2018-02-02 10:15:35.000000000', 'message': "Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in any branches by master/queens.

Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

commit_message:
Improve console install and restart services appropriately

The current implementation wipes out the novnc/spice directory
every single time the playbook executes. While it does replace
it afterwards it does not fire a notifier to make the service
restart, resulting in the service failing.

This patch makes the install process idempotent - it will only
wipe out the directory if it does not look the way it is
expected to look. It also fires the notifier to restart services
if the git repo changes.

This should ensure that novnc/spice restart properly on upgrades
and that there are no changes/restarts for the service if the git
SHA or software does not change.

Backport note:
The 'Manage LB' handler notification is removed as it is not
present in ocata.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/540437
Closes-Bug: #1746523
Change-Id: Ic39f884016a6ba0498110267027783001a087a1c
(cherry picked from commit c41103ba702cd6fd85d8e4d4fe86caef81623f44)

subject: Add a delay before the cell discovery
messages:
[{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:00:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:15:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:40:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Haven't run into this in prod, but it does makes sense to me when there is no auto discovery and little delay between bringing up a node and wanting to build a VM.

I looked back through the logs where this failed, http://logs.openstack.org/29/540329/6/gate/openstack-ansible-upgrade-ubuntu-xenial/4e54366/ ,and the discover_hosts command ran just ~15 seconds before the compute node registered."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-16 17:41:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 13:38:33.000000000', 'message': "[TEST] Add a delay before the cell discovery

We're seeing a race condition during upgrades which
causes the upgrade test to fail due to the compute
host not being proerly registered somehow. This patch
introduces a little bit of extra time to see if it
helps.

Change-Id: Ice9deb82f052075f3b8a6ed1bc2387aac365d1fd
"}, {'created': '2018-02-16 15:15:28.000000000', 'message': "Add a delay before the cell discovery

We're seeing a race condition during the upgrade test
for the role which causes the test to fail due to the
compute host not being proerly registered somehow. This
patch introduces a little bit of extra time between the
compute host being available and the cell discovery
executing which seems to help.

The extra delay is *only* executed in the role test
where the nova_discover_hosts_in_cells_interval is set
to -1. In a normal production environment it has no
effect.

Change-Id: Ice9deb82f052075f3b8a6ed1bc2387aac365d1fd
"}]
commit_message:
Add a delay before the cell discovery

We're seeing a race condition during the upgrade test
for the role which causes the test to fail due to the
compute host not being proerly registered somehow. This
patch introduces a little bit of extra time between the
compute host being available and the cell discovery
executing which seems to help.

The extra delay is *only* executed in the role test
where the nova_discover_hosts_in_cells_interval is set
to -1. In a normal production environment it has no
effect.

Change-Id: Ice9deb82f052075f3b8a6ed1bc2387aac365d1fd

commit_message:
Add SELinux contexts for neutron log directory

The log directory for neutron has the default_t SELinux context and this
prevents rsyslog from accessing neutron's logs. This patch ensures that
the file contexts are set properly for neutron's logs.

This change also makes neutron's log directory configurable using the
`neutron_log_dir` variable.

Closes-Bug: 1748968
Change-Id: Ifbcca131435c8963cc9c1b85c000cc040fab27ab

commit_message:
Fix neutron upgrades

With the latest ops changes, we use the clouds.yaml
file for API testing.

We therefore need to generate it on localhost, where the
API tests are located.

On top of this, the scripts are modified to consider that
previous branch is now queens, not pike.

Change-Id: I0c1d6298cd394426b6e4acbc1859c901fdd80439
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
Add SELinux contexts for cinder log directory

The log directory for cinder has the default_t SELinux context and this
prevents rsyslog from accessing cinders's logs. This patch ensures that
the file contexts are set properly for cinders's logs.

This change also makes cinder's log directory configurable using the
`cinder_log_dir` variable.

Closes-Bug: 1748969
Change-Id: Idd1abdd5987ef120b23f8eef49b1c5198f40d900

commit_message:
Freezer-scheduler support both APIs

This patch allows freezer-scheduler to use either API v1 or v2
You can alter it using OS_BACKUP_API_VERSION env variable

Depends-On: I83000f8bf39eed41d067ed663de9f459439eca9a
Change-Id: I2e5724b1f1a75121952e2beb3844d2c489e4df68

commit_message:
look up the governance project id by name

Assuming a project id by number means it is harder to test the script
against a development instance of storyboard.

Change-Id: I69efd54feddf479df66e876ee3659fa217a37af6
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Remove systemd conditionals

All operating systems supported by the role use systemd and these
conditional checks are no longer needed.

Change-Id: Iffa9a7ed561e5d460a51f7492dde19ad9a8ed59c

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 01:51:02.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder: set ownership of co-ordination backend for remaining services

This PS sets the ownership of the co-ordination backend location
when using the default file backend. This does not make the service
functional but prevents errors when calling it.

Change-Id: I2b05bc728fef84e404f9a03a5316cd122f246bce
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder: set ownership of co-ordination backend for remaining services

This PS sets the ownership of the co-ordination backend location
when using the default file backend. This does not make the service
functional but prevents errors when calling it.

Change-Id: I2b05bc728fef84e404f9a03a5316cd122f246bce

'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: note that force detach is admin-only by default

I had to dig into the code to figure out that the force
detach volume action was for admins by default. We should
make that clear in the API reference.

Change-Id: I3493e23dba8267fb7e403d30dd0d1e90c8f7726b

subject: Args: Add distrobution packages to args
messages:
[{'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:21:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:27:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So here is a turning point. do we create profiles for *everything* or do we add a PACKAGES envvar like PIP_PACKAGES where you can overload anything?

I dont want *every* package listed here, and i dont know the balance.

I was half thinking this would be used for multipackage things (like ceph) or off-the-wall things like "configdrive" even though its a single package'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> So here is a turning point. do we create profiles for *everything*
 > or do we add a PACKAGES envvar like PIP_PACKAGES where you can
 > overload anything?
 > 
 > I dont want *every* package listed here, and i dont know the
 > balance.
 > 
 > I was half thinking this would be used for multipackage things
 > (like ceph) or off-the-wall things like "configdrive" even though
 > its a single package

I think a DIST_PACKAGES would probably be the right path here, as I agree this could quickly grow out of control.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-01-17 00:54:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14119, 'date': '2018-01-17 02:52:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Args: Add distrobution packages to args

This PS adds the ability to install arbitary distrobution
packages via args, allowing development and deployment helper
utilities to be simply included in an image.

Change-Id: Id3ce8bceda185978e1d1843072aac44f49b3d95a

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:01:55.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefully handle missing metadata in libvirt xml

Missing metadata in the libvirt domain xml for a nova instance would
cause ceilometer-compute to abort, leading to missing metrics for the
current and any subequent libvirt guests.

This commit puts a try/except AttributeError block around all the code
that is fetching attributes on the result of metadata_xml.find(...).

Change-Id: I8adc609cc21c86de2daba326d24b73a80d6eb61f
Closes-Bug: #1749960
'}]
commit_message:
Gracefully handle missing metadata in libvirt xml

Missing metadata in the libvirt domain xml for a nova instance would
cause ceilometer-compute to abort, leading to missing metrics for the
current and any subequent libvirt guests.

This commit puts a try/except AttributeError block around all the code
that is fetching attributes on the result of metadata_xml.find(...).

Change-Id: I8adc609cc21c86de2daba326d24b73a80d6eb61f
Closes-Bug: #1749960

commit_message:
Cleaned up minimal role, deprecated provisioning cookbook

- The minimal role contains a subset of allinone for use in integration. This
  allows to execute Tempest at the end of the Chef run.
- Being that chef-provisioning-vagrant is no longer working as of ChefDK 2.x,
  the provisioning cookbook serves no functional purpose.

Change-Id: I99a6de49640356c98adadf3237dc68383be06bb4
Implements: blueprint modern-chef
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542612
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/542613

commit_message:
Add basic functional testing for swift3

This commit adds the following swift3 functional testing:

 1. Install and configure `s3cmd` utility
 2. Verify bucket creation
 3. Verify object upload
 4. Verify object listing
 5. Verify object and bucket deletion

Change-Id: I6290e8b02004f6c518983700a6439d28fbd127a4
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>
(cherry picked from commit ea0d7bdb3e9a72d0c4d321a268227c84ddc9b270)

On my (local) macbook:
    xargs: illegal option -- r

The -r is a gnu extension.

Do we support macbooks? If not, then this is ok, if yes, then this is not ok. For now, what if we just delete (or comment out) the entire check, since we have no .po or .pot files?

fwiw, the '?' used in the --regex didn't work either on my macbook, so no files were found, yet the command 'succeeded' w/o needing the -r."}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2018-02-14 19:22:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

also, msgfmt doesn't exist.

I should probably stop using my laptop to do any serious coding.

Given that the existing thing didn't work on macbook, I'm fine if the new thing doesn't work either (even though the new thing fails worse). So I'm going to +2 but not going to approve, in case someone else objects :)"}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-14 23:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Eh.... I feel bad even putting a -1 on here, but we _should_ likely have it such that the commands can be executed on osx and linux.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-02-14 23:15:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

So tl;dr, I'd <3 for this to be OSX friendly. I can be convinced otherwise!"}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-15 09:28:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> what if we just delete (or comment out) the entire check, since we have no .po or .pot files?

I was thinking about this as well. In the end, the pot? files are autogenerated nowadays'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-15 09:30:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-02-15 09:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

[{'created': '2018-02-12 16:11:04.000000000', 'message': 'tox: fix pep8 to not fail if no pot files are found

The recent translation update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542609/
removes the last pot file and this validation starts failing.
This change replaces find|xargs with find -exec to fix that.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 14:02:55.000000000', 'message': 'tox: fix pep8 to not fail if no pot files are found

This change adds -r flag to xargs to prevent it from running msgfmt
without input files.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708
'}, {'created': '2018-02-15 09:30:25.000000000', 'message': 'tox: stop validating locale files

They are autogenerated, and the updates are submitted automatically.
There is no much value in validating them. Also the recent translation

file and this validation starts failing.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708

commit_message:
tox: stop validating locale files

They are autogenerated, and the updates are submitted automatically.
There is no much value in validating them. Also the recent translation
update https://review.openstack.org/#/c/542609/ removes the last pot
file and this validation starts failing.

Change-Id: I08a5c6acf4312df307aee4ba66f3d957191c8708

commit_message:
Update init to work when inheriting from `overcloud deploy`

The `overcloud update stack --init-update` command will inherit from
`overcloud deploy` [1], and as such it needs `--templates` parameter.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/540798/

Change-Id: Ifd047eab8326e913919b5b8911e10d93cba4f3a9

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ia4e1faabf35b0c5f46fdc431a52c88754f0abc5f

commit_message:
Switch swift API tests to mock

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test modules:
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/test_swift.py
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_swift.py

Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

Change-Id: I3c920564b781c9c1c97bd6ee22b834504c94cb60

commit_message:
Use the last name of a file path of deployment-files parameter.

IR uses basename of deployment-files path as a base for
 environment files. Use same mechanism here when looking for
 docker-images.yaml file.

Change-Id: I135ed98b45616e4daa49a68393818c1f2458c6d9

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:40:12.000000000', 'message': "Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8
(cherry picked from commit 7ab62ddbea8c1bc3f350bd1319097240813ca476)
"}]
commit_message:
Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8
(cherry picked from commit 7ab62ddbea8c1bc3f350bd1319097240813ca476)

[{'account_id': 27846, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:40:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:40:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I2947b5bd2873f1f9eedd2f5f2480c7f03ddda180
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit ebf011624fcb86d1f17ead7feb6d4887cc03db1b)

commit_message:
Handle Pike deprecations for Ironic

Following the release notes:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/pike.html

On top of that, ironic_glance_host was never used anywhere, and was
removed.

Change-Id: I1fbdc0660eccd75299e734b36b99509d388348cf
(cherry picked from commit a9702301b4f2cba805bbb2239a88b6f897ef7095)

subject: Replace virtualenv-tools by a script
messages: [{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:42:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/pike as commit 83aa2a404cd5e8fe5813b2ece2db6ae65e26aec9'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-16 14:46:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 14:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)
"}]
commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634
(cherry picked from commit 2b51da5f0a3a1c088c5e8c27a2907e781ac6a131)

results.

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I1c24fef4a3b40bc70ea871b32c930b3e7048672d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit cf5ca79709982a296037799991e18f2c9b775ebb)

commit_message:
Revert from packaged tempest to git, update image refs

- due to inconsistencies in RDO versus UCA packaging, Tempest performs more
  consistently from upstream git
- update cirros references to 0.4.0

Change-Id: I374497db1b602683f1f9c62489f523b18c50266c
Implements: blueprint modern-chef

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 16:23:35.000000000', 'message': "Adds --all option to overcloud upgrade for running all playbooks

This adds the --all option to the UpgradeOvercloud subclass.
Since we are subclassing, during major upgrade the operator must
specify the playbook to execute, otherwise the default
update_steps_playbook.yaml is used (which is wrong as that is for
minor update).

If this is an upgrade and the operator didn't specify at least one
of --all or --playbook then raise Exception and don't proceed.

If --all is passed then run upgrade, then deploy then post_upgrade
steps playbooks in sequence.

Change-Id: Ifdc727d7e71a95d4e211968e0b661b3646ff6aa3

commit_message:
Adds --all-playbooks option to overcloud upgrade to run all playbooks

This adds the --all-playbooks option to the UpgradeOvercloud subclass.
Since we are subclassing, during major upgrade the operator must
specify the playbook to execute, otherwise the default
update_steps_playbook.yaml is used (which is wrong as that is for
minor update).

If this is an upgrade and the operator didn't specify at least one
of --all-playbooks or --playbook then sys.exit(1).

If --all-playbooks is passed then run upgrade, then deploy then
post_upgrade steps playbooks in sequence.

Change-Id: Ifdc727d7e71a95d4e211968e0b661b3646ff6aa3

Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 22:54:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LXC volume size

Change-Id: Ib9b23b023d2ad03ce72c4abce5dc9e51d4643ac0

'}, {'created': '2018-02-16 11:47:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix LXC volume size

With the change to allow volumes to dynamically grow we need to define
the default volume size to contain a valid size modifier. At present the
value is creating a sparse file that is 1024 bytes. This change sets the
size to gigabytes.

The role pin is updated to include the changes in the lxc_hosts role
which use this method of configuration. Without it the quota setting
end up with a GG at the end, which is invalid and the command fails.

Change-Id: Ib9b23b023d2ad03ce72c4abce5dc9e51d4643ac0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix LXC volume size

With the change to allow volumes to dynamically grow we need to define
the default volume size to contain a valid size modifier. At present the
value is creating a sparse file that is 1024 bytes. This change sets the
size to gigabytes.

The role pin is updated to include the changes in the lxc_hosts role
which use this method of configuration. Without it the quota setting
end up with a GG at the end, which is invalid and the command fails.

Change-Id: Ib9b23b023d2ad03ce72c4abce5dc9e51d4643ac0
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Fix ARA/log data collection and reporting

Currently the ARA database is not collected after each
test, nor is the reporting done as it should be. This
patch does the following to resolve that:

1. Informs the log collection to collect to and from
   the right source folder.

2. Verifies that the logs directory exists to ensure
   that a missing directory does not cause the job to
   fail.

3. Makes the log collection quiet, so that only errors
   are reported when pulling them back to the zuul
   executor.

4. Removes a layer of indirection by making zuul use
   the scripts library directly instead of working
   through yet another wrapper script.

5. Sets the exit code properly so that the ARA report
   is run on test execution failure.

Change-Id: Ie8da165a33180d03c840a69dae0aa5f424a69e50

[{'created': '2018-02-16 11:20:43.000000000', 'message': 'Update os_magnum role pin

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which pins
kubernetes and related dependencies and the release note
to communicate the change.

Change-Id: I49312a568ff6ce74497f00eec288166707e33fc0
'}]
commit_message:
Update os_magnum role pin

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which pins
kubernetes and related dependencies and the release note
to communicate the change.

Change-Id: I49312a568ff6ce74497f00eec288166707e33fc0

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-06 18:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'Reduce scope: do not merge misplaced objects into container listing

Before, while a container was sharding, any misplaced objects
(i.e. updates received since sharding started, for ranges not yet
found) would be merged with the listing from the retired db in an
attempt to give the most up to date listing. However, the merging code
was flawed as it did not respect the data, content-type and metadata
timestamps when merging, but erroneously assumed that all misplaced
objects were newer than those in the retired db.

This patch removes the flawed merge code and consequently listings of
as yet uncleaved ranges will not include recently received updates
that are in the misplaced objects table.

Misplaced objects will be included when cleaving a shard range and will
then appear in the concatenated listing that is constructed by the
proxy server.

Change-Id: If58a2e943ccca2e6898dce7c9a2883e870d9cdbb

commit_message:
Reduce scope: do not merge misplaced objects into container listing

Before, while a container was sharding, any misplaced objects
(i.e. updates received since sharding started, for ranges not yet
found) would be merged with the listing from the retired db in an
attempt to give the most up to date listing. However, the merging code
was flawed as it did not respect the data, content-type and metadata
timestamps when merging, but erroneously assumed that all misplaced
objects were newer than those in the retired db.

This patch removes the flawed merge code and consequently listings of
as yet uncleaved ranges will not include recently received updates
that are in the misplaced objects table.

Misplaced objects will be included when cleaving a shard range and will
then appear in the concatenated listing that is constructed by the
proxy server.

Also removes an 'expectedFailure' unit test that covered merging
lists from two dbs.

Change-Id: If58a2e943ccca2e6898dce7c9a2883e870d9cdbb

TripleO memory usage was 1.12GiB, compared to 1.31GiB for a recent CI run (http://logs.openstack.org/72/531572/2/check-tripleo/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-ha-oooq/831bfb6/) - a reduction of 14%.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:33:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-16 15:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Cherry Picked

This patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/queens as commit cbcc15b4046d456032441105941a4a4ea93b48e6'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

times in each create/update).

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

commit_message:
Don't load nested stack to get ResourceGroup blacklist

In ResourceGroup, we (unwisely in retrospect) allow blacklisting of
resources by reference ID (i.e. physical resource ID in most cases). In
order to both determine whether a removal policy entry was an existing
resource name and (if not) to find the resource by physical ID, we would
always load the nested stack into memory.

To avoid this, unconditionally create an output in the nested stack that
returns a mapping of all the resource reference IDs and use it for finding
a resource with a matching reference ID. Only if the output is not
available (because the nested stack hasn't been updated since prior to the
output being defined), fall back to the old way of doing it.

Avoid looking up IDs for names that already appear in the blacklist
(because they were blacklisted in a previous update and have been removed
from the stack.)

Since this is more expensive in time (though hopefully cheaper in space),
update the blacklist only once on resource creation and whenever it
actually changes during an update. This is accomplished by moving the
update to a separate function that is called explicitly, rather than making
it a side-effect of getting the current blacklist (which occurs up to 4
times in each create/update).

Change-Id: Ic32d7d99bad06f92b3d2919d58cd1f9128bcfe83
Partial-Bug: #1731349

Rename our base job

Rename to add "-base" to the base job to follow Zuul conventions, also
add abstract to mark that this cannot run on its own and needs to be
inherited from.

[{'created': '2018-01-29 22:41:09.000000000', 'message': "api-ref: provide more detail on what a provider aggregate is

The description of placement resource provider aggregates is mostly
discussing how they aren't nova's concept of host aggregates, but
doesn't give a very simple description of what they are.

This provides a simple description and the canonical example of a
shared storage pool.

Change-Id: I3b7c6404d364c045f19390e86fd1b747baf11f8c
"}]
commit_message:
api-ref: provide more detail on what a provider aggregate is

The description of placement resource provider aggregates is mostly
discussing how they aren't nova's concept of host aggregates, but
doesn't give a very simple description of what they are.

This provides a simple description and the canonical example of a
shared storage pool.

Change-Id: I3b7c6404d364c045f19390e86fd1b747baf11f8c

commit_message:
Join cluster without using a failed task

Currently a new node joining the cluster is done by using
a try/rescue operation which always fails for a new node,
causing a lot of confusion due to the failed task report.

This patch ensures that the implementation no longer does
that.

In order to prevent lint check failures, each join task
has a 'changed_when: true' added.

Change-Id: Ic1da9f3ad1016831fe37643165880e7ff98ca923

There are references that are pointing to master in each role.
This should change them.

[{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-10 03:40:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-10 03:47:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-10 04:01:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-10 04:20:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:51:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

This takes away the ability to use pip links which is useful if the repo build has produced wheels. Over time we will move towards something like this, but it's a bit premature - we need to get repo build changed up to put its results into the pypiserver cache first, then we can drop the requirement to use pip links. even then, pip links are also there to allow propriatery packages to be installed, so they need to stay - they just won't be used in a standard build."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-11 15:54:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-11 16:32:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> This takes away the ability to use pip links which is useful if the
 > repo build has produced wheels. Over time we will move towards
 > something like this, but it's a bit premature - we need to get repo
 > build changed up to put its results into the pypiserver cache
 > first, then we can drop the requirement to use pip links. even
 > then, pip links are also there to allow propriatery packages to be
 > installed, so they need to stay - they just won't be used in a
 > standard build.

With PR https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526886 the pypi-server cache has been set to serve the actual pools directory. This change simply instructs pip to consume the pypi-server index and lock the wheels down to a set of known absolute constraints."}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-12 06:43:32.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-12 07:03:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Published edit on patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2017-12-12 10:25:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-10 03:40:10.000000000', 'message': 'Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa
Depends-On: Icc2ee264fc213b258642b5393dd78b1b26ef0542
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-12-12 06:43:32.000000000', 'message': 'Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so

commit_message:
Set pip to use the pypi-server when locked down

The repo server now hosts a native pypi-server. This new server allows
us to use a native pip install instead of our existing "find-links"
approach. Moving to the native pypi server is not only faster, it is also
more scalable. This change agments our existing wheel lockdown by
setting the index to our new pypi-server and defining an online
constraint file in the pip.conf.

Additional checks have been set within the configuration task file so
that we're confirming pip can be locked down prior to setting the
pip.conf file which can, and will break a deployment if configured
incorrectly. These tasks will only fire when the option
`pip_lock_to_internal_repo` has been set to "true" making them a no-op
by default.

Change-Id: I2f9aaa1aecf7d03a833f60d483de364d6a6d64fa
Depends-On: Icc2ee264fc213b258642b5393dd78b1b26ef0542
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

We should backport the change to include the clouds.yaml, and

commit_message:
Temporarily disable swift upgrade testing

Swift doesn't get clouds.yaml on localhost, which is used for
API testing.

We should backport the change to include the clouds.yaml, and
reinstate the gating of the upgrades.

Change-Id: I5c4d01530fc4f0d1200d0c836e48d81b549bcb2c

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools by a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: Iad3a44f35c57d92dcbbfde4acbd86a3a4eb1879d
Partial-Bug: #1741634

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: Ic09301ca37d497c3400dd9678cf754c71510410a
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I1c24fef4a3b40bc70ea871b32c930b3e7048672d
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

Hey Charles, I'm a bit out of the loop on this stuff so don't quite understand this change.  Is none of this stuff tested at the moment, and if not is there nothin native we can use to test this rather than using some external tool (s3cmd)?"}, {'account_id': 17264, 'date': '2017-08-15 16:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Matt.  Swift3 middleware support was recently added in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/374416/.  The middleware provides an S3 compatibility layer in front of swift.  This commit will be the first testing with swift3 enabled in the middleware pipeline (i.e. with "swift_swift3_enabled=True" set).  Since an S3 client is required to test functionality of the middleware, I don't believe there is a native OpenStack alternative to s3cmd.'}, {'account_id': 7307, 'date': '2017-08-15 19:37:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Thanks for the clarification, Charles!'}, {'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-08-16 00:24:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-08-16 01:34:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
Add basic functional testing for swift3

This commit adds the following swift3 functional testing:

 1. Install and configure `s3cmd` utility
 2. Verify bucket creation
 3. Verify object upload
 4. Verify object listing
 5. Verify object and bucket deletion

Change-Id: I6290e8b02004f6c518983700a6439d28fbd127a4
Co-Authored-By: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
Lay out a clouds.yaml file before upgrading

Upgrades use the clouds.yaml instead of environment variables
to test APIs. Swift doesn't have openstack_openrc in meta, and
no role that applies to localhost in the whole functional test
path has it. So we have to include openstack_openrc role.

Change-Id: I5196ab338659c65a6a3b7ac03095bbfb1e26c0a8

similar to the other OSH repos.

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I3fc0e1597785ee101f362c028744da466a141ded
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

commit_message:
Handle Pike deprecations for Ironic

Following the release notes:
https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/ironic/pike.html

On top of that, ironic_glance_host was never used anywhere, and was
removed.

Change-Id: I1fbdc0660eccd75299e734b36b99509d388348cf

commit_message:
Add release notes

We've enabled the release notes zuul job quite late in the release
cycle, for which reason some of the notes are missing, being added
by this change.

This change also adds a reference to the release notes page on
the main compute-hyperv docs page.

Change-Id: If5c717bad101b55379201a02afe6f88b3cd9345d

commit_message:
Set proper yum repo priority on CentOS 7

This patch ensures that we get galera from the MariaDB repos
and not from RDO. This matches I2c8e4e64c2425cd36903ae9288bd9fee29eef355
which did the same thing for the galera-server role.

Closes-Bug: #1739472
Change-Id: I8f22083a306ba7569148a53af94397c31d90dbac

messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:54:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:59:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-16 13:35:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 09:54:58.000000000', 'message': 'Show errors when copying logs

In https://review.openstack.org/544998 the logging of the
files copied was removed from logging altogether. In this
patch we achieve the goal of not showing all the files
copied, but we still show errors which is more informative
without wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2
'}]
commit_message:
Show errors when copying logs

In https://review.openstack.org/544998 the logging of the
files copied was removed from logging altogether. In this
patch we achieve the goal of not showing all the files
copied, but we still show errors which is more informative
without wasting log lines.

Change-Id: Iffe4baad65d1d2a1812e62f78d54441ae8dbaff2

messages:
[{'account_id': 27593, 'date': '2018-01-25 22:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-01-25 23:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC

commit_message:
Set correct group membership of /var/log/mysql_logs directory

This patch sets group membership to `adm`.
It makes Galera log files accessible for rsyslog daemon.

Change-Id: Id156037ad053b62036b5359f12eabbf54e7e1369
Closes-Bug: #1745442

devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a

commit_message:
Generate a unique machine-id

The systemd machine-id needs to be unique on all network attached
devices. This change ensures that when a container comes online, a
unique machine-id is generated if one was not already present. When
the machine-id is created for the first time the container will restart
so the new ID can take effect.

More information on the machine-id can be found here:
https://www.freedesktop.org/software/systemd/man/machine-id.html

Change-Id: Ib25aeeecf1e6001e6c6b1a7d6b6d50eca7ab45fa
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Stop running non-voting jobs in gate

There isn't a need to run non-voting jobs in gate, as it ends up just
wasting CI resources.  Results can be obtained from the check pipeline
results.

Change-Id: I017a5d979fd70f086860b0604b4cec4d8891b1ba
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Install only the required storage driver extras

At the moment, all drivers are being installed for Gnocchi even
if some of them are not used.  This also means that some libraries
are being built which are not needed (such as for Ceph or Swift
when using file storage).

This patch switches the behaviour to install only the extra for
the driver in use.

Change-Id: I6e9f938885036d2fabc81094e01e220b09e462dd

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-14 13:43:20.000000000', 'message': 'Fix for ssh provisioning of VirtualBox VMs

This fix addresses the limitation in VirtualBox that you cannot
set the boot device while the node is powered on. Provisioning
of VirtualBox VMs with the pxe_ssh driver will fail because it
attempts to the set the boot device prior to booting the
tenant image.

This fix will detect whether the VirtualBox node is powered on,
and if so will store the target boot device for later
application when the node is next powered on.

There is existing logic controlled by the use_headless option
that addresses this behavior by powering off the node as part of
setting the boot device; however, this approach interferes with
the overall deployment workflow. I have kept this behavior in
place for backward compatibility, but when use_headless is not
set the new logic that stores the boot device is used.

Change-Id: Id0f1db0eea520eeae40af11a924bf8174ff2920c
Closes-Bug: #1682814

commit_message:
Fix for ssh provisioning of VirtualBox VMs

This fix addresses the limitation in VirtualBox that you cannot
set the boot device while the node is powered on. Provisioning
of VirtualBox VMs with the pxe_ssh driver will fail because it
attempts to the set the boot device prior to booting the
tenant image.

This fix will detect whether the VirtualBox node is powered on,
and if so will store the target boot device for later
application when the node is next powered on.

There is existing logic controlled by the use_headless option
that addresses this behavior by powering off the node as part of
setting the boot device; however, this approach interferes with
the overall deployment workflow. I have kept this behavior in
place for backward compatibility, but when use_headless is not
set the new logic that stores the boot device is used.

Change-Id: Id0f1db0eea520eeae40af11a924bf8174ff2920c
Closes-Bug: #1682814

I guess, I'm curious what problem is truly trying to be solved here."}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2016-10-21 12:47:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

the problem being solved is the same this spec https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/6.2/ipxe-swift-tempurls.html is solving for integrated case (where swift/tempurls are available) but for standalone case.

If the agent on the node can download the target image over e.g. clean HTTP, why not allow downloading kernel and ramdisk for deployment image from the same storage if supported by iPXE firmware?

I'll file a proper RFE."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-10-21 22:37:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Verified-1

I also explored if this could be driven by node's properties/capabilities instead, but it seems they currently do not support complex data structures (e.g. lists) as values, only strings. This is a great idea. However, I'm opposed to creating an option for it. We (OpenStack) have too many options already, this does not seem to bring particular value. Let's just make it the default for protocols where it's possible?"}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-03-30 15:16:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

> We (OpenStack) have too many options already
That's a complex world we live in :)

> this does not seem to bring particular value
I oppose. There are situations when disabling (as by proposed default) or extending this list might be needed/desired:

- for example, the network topology prevents nodes to reach the image store from provisioning network, but only conductor can - then this must be left disabled
- or there is new hardware that supports booting from some other protocols (iSCSI?). As this is mostly for standalone case, the operator can create and configure access to the deploy ramdisk by whatever protocol the hardware supports."}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-04-13 14:37:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

Ok, this make sense. But why not make http and https enabled by default?'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-04-13 18:17:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-09-08 12:02:59.000000000', 'message': "iPXE allow skip caching in standalone mode

In Ironic standalone mode, deployment kernel and ramdisk images are usually
stored on an external image service like HTTP server.
When iPXE is enabled, nodes can boot from those images directly without
caching them on conductor and serving over conductor's own HTTP server.

This patch adds a new config option `[pxe]ipxe_supported_schemes` (list
option).
Deployment images with URI's of such schemes will not be cached and
served locally, instead iPXE on nodes will attempt to boot from such
URIs directly.
Default for this new option is empty list to keep backward compatibility
with current behaviour.

Change-Id: I2b6180a89589a7f545815c16615494a623e1b322
Related-Bug: #1526404

commit_message:
iPXE allow skip caching in standalone mode

In Ironic standalone mode, deployment kernel and ramdisk images are usually
stored on an external image service like HTTP server.
When iPXE is enabled, nodes can boot from those images directly without
caching them on conductor and serving over conductor's own HTTP server.

This patch adds a new config option `[pxe]ipxe_boot_directly_from` (list
option).
Deployment images with URI's of schemes listed in this option
will not be cached and served locally,
instead iPXE on nodes will attempt to boot from such URIs directly.
Default for this new option is empty list to keep backward compatibility
with current behaviour.

Change-Id: I2b6180a89589a7f545815c16615494a623e1b322
Related-Bug: #1526404

commit_message:
Add option --version to Zanata pull_catalog

During translation phase it's required to pull different versions from
translation server instead only master branch.

Change-Id: I27ab5f678aae71846f5ec6191be08e05cf72e53e

commit_message:
Don't update group blacklist on validation

Now that blacklist can be reduced, resource group validation can be
broken as we try to update the group during preview. Let's prevent that.

Change-Id: I9090310c57b1fbc59f1e19f4ec823685fff1a812
Closes-Bug: #1749426

[{'created': '2018-02-08 14:28:49.000000000', 'message': 'Make routed networks optional

Tripleo-UI does not yet support configuring baremetal
ports. Routed networks require the ``physical-network``
attribute of baremetal ports to be set.

Make routed networks optional, so that Triplo-UI can
be used for non routed networks deployments.

subject: Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-01-27 19:28:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-02-09 05:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7385, 'date': '2018-02-16 10:30:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 23:20:20.000000000', 'message': "Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

The InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup implementations are more complex
than those of ResourceGroup and ResourceChain because they exclude failed
resources at runtime, and also must have a stable sort order for list-type
outputs that cannot be determined at template generation time. Therefore
the underlying output value is always a dict, and the attribute value is
calculated from it.

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-09 20:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa
Partial-Bug: #1731349
"}, {'created': '2018-01-19 20:42:54.000000000', 'message': "Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in

these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This

output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

The InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup implementations are more complex
than those of ResourceGroup and ResourceChain because they exclude failed
resources at runtime, and also must have a stable sort order for list-type
outputs that cannot be determined at template generation time. Therefore

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa

commit_message:
Get Instance/AutoScalingGroup attributes from nested stack outputs

Since Pike we've generated the templates for various nested stack resource
types with outputs that produce the attribute values that are referenced in
the parent stack, and a previous patch did the same for resource IDs. Use
these output values when available to calculate the attribute values. This
is efficient, because the all of the outputs are fetched together and
cached, and avoids using the grouputils functions that cause the nested
stack to get loaded into memory in the same process.

Fall back to the existing implementation (using grouputils) if the required
output isn't available (generally this would be due to the nested stack
being created on an earlier version of Heat that did not include the
outputs in the generated template, and not updated since).

The InstanceGroup and AutoScalingGroup implementations are more complex
than those of ResourceGroup and ResourceChain because they exclude failed
resources at runtime, and also must have a stable sort order for list-type
outputs that cannot be determined at template generation time. Therefore
the underlying output value is always a dict, and the attribute value is
calculated from it.

Change-Id: Ie4ad85068fdc16b8038a09df709ed7eb86434cfa
Partial-Bug: #1731349

Switch Nova API tests to mock

This patch changes mox to mock for the following test modules:
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/test_nova.py
* openstack_dashboard/test/unit/api/rest/test_nova.py

Partially-Implements: blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests

commit_message:
Provide a way to disable mox completely

This commit introduces 'use_mox' attribute to TestCase class.
If this is set to False, TestCase does not setup mox.

In addition, a common method to emit the deprecation warning
was introduced in APITestCase.

Part of blueprint mock-framework-in-unit-tests
Change-Id: I1e3df7ea2a867b8a7aa69523bed2beaab9663dc0

commit_message:
tempest: remove now-useless workarounds for unreliable tests

Some workarounds/tuning where in place to accomodate
with stale ARP entries for gateway IP addresses dut to
bug 1748234 in reference driver.

Now that this bug is fixed, this change removes these
workarounds.

Change-Id: I0023865d443aaa14566ba40a2ed348978e2fb4d4
Related-Bug: 1748234

commit_message:
[Trivial] docs: fix code blocks indentation

For some code blocks, we have a superfluous 2-space indentation.
For this reason, the generated docs are quite inconsistent.

This change fixes this issue.

[{'created': '2018-02-15 18:09:39.000000000', 'message': "Properly constrain magnum dependencies

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

Given that Ocata is a bit old and we're unlikely to be
able to change the project's behaviour, we implement
our own pins in the repo for the extra dependencies
(both direct and indirect).

Change-Id: I987cfd2f1fa2be967c4cd86a00f9071915e25973
"}, {'created': '2018-02-15 18:12:04.000000000', 'message': "Properly constrain magnum dependencies

are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

Given that Ocata is a bit old and we're unlikely to be
able to change the project's behaviour, we implement
our own pins in the repo for the extra dependencies
(both direct and indirect).

The chain of dependencies is as follows:

magnum -> kubernetes -> google-auth
                     -> requests-oauthlib

The pins we set here are the maximum versions available

commit_message:
Properly constrain magnum dependencies

The magnum source repository unfortunately is not
adhering to the global requirements management process
in that it has requirements specified in the repo which
are not in the global requirements repo.

As a result of the requirement being missing, those
requirements are not constrained by upper-constraints.
That, in turn, causes the repo build to fail to build
the magnum venv due to incompatible requirements.

Given that Ocata is a bit old and we're unlikely to be
able to change the project's behaviour, we implement
our own pins in the repo for the extra dependencies
(both direct and indirect).

The pins we set here are based on the upper-constraints
for pike which do no conflict with the rest of the ocata
libraries.

Change-Id: I987cfd2f1fa2be967c4cd86a00f9071915e25973

commit_message:
Change include: to include_tasks:

This removes warnings in Ansible 2.4+.

The patch also removes "static:" from the playbooks since that
argument is no longer used by Ansible.

Change-Id: I6e5fcbccd4239db73de20e640a3423d1a2333bbe

subject: Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin
messages: [{'account_id': 538, 'date': '2018-02-15 17:22:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-02-16 09:56:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 17:22:23.000000000', 'message': "Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the
yum's fastestmirror plugin. It is helpful if you are running outside
the OpenStack CI system since it will find the fastest mirrors from
a publicly available mirror list.

However, in the CI system, we override the mirror list with a hard-
coded mirror in the `baseurl` line. There's no need to load or use
the fastestmirror plugin in these situations and gathering a list
of mirrors just slows things down.

This patch sets a fact that other roles can check and disable the
fastestmirror plugin when needed.

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
(cherry picked from commit 63375381736f29a0265e06d3e4ae3408a73c8ec9)
"}]
commit_message:
Set a fact for handling yum's fastestmirror plugin

In the past, we've messed around with enabling or disabling the
yum's fastestmirror plugin. It is helpful if you are running outside
the OpenStack CI system since it will find the fastest mirrors from
a publicly available mirror list.

However, in the CI system, we override the mirror list with a hard-
coded mirror in the `baseurl` line. There's no need to load or use
the fastestmirror plugin in these situations and gathering a list
of mirrors just slows things down.

This patch sets a fact that other roles can check and disable the
fastestmirror plugin when needed.

Change-Id: I8b2a1db084ab47962dbef8c6b037836f44b4ed46
(cherry picked from commit 63375381736f29a0265e06d3e4ae3408a73c8ec9)

commit_message:
Update IRC nick for Dougal Matthews (me)

This was incorrect, due to my miss-understanding of the filename in the
election repo. I thought it was a convention of first initial and
surname, rather than the IRC nick. This is what happens when you copy
others and don't read the instructions.

Change-Id: I2e580068a81ba733789a848f8d3ce7ebcecada08

Closes-Bug: 1737776
'}]
commit_message:
Further use of ordered dicts.

For consistent rendering of the haproxy template under Python 3,
ensure that ordered dictionaries are used so that dict iteration
always results in the same template output.

Change-Id: I119027810e7f7976c794ff7f34a902d256f8963d
Closes-Bug: 1737776

commit_message:
Add stable/queens version of the full neutron job

Use the override-checkout feature at job level to get all branched
repos from stable/queens. Define both py27 and py3 jobs.

Change-Id: I81e63e690512e6b6eacf3d255feaf73a425d957e

commit_message:
Fix monasca-ceilometer ceilometer.metering.storage config typo

When replacing the list of ceilometer.metering.storage entries to
add monasca, a typo caused the ceilometer.sample.publisher list
to be overwritten with the ceilometer.metering.storage list.

Change-Id: Icdf62bb7b4ba4552411361324098938aee3c5592
