[{'created': '2018-02-12 13:49:08.000000000', 'message': "Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

This patch fixes slowing of the router's migration due to a slow query
to the database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
"}, {'created': '2018-02-13 08:45:01.000000000', 'message': "Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

This patch fixes slowing of the router's migration due to a slow query
to the database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
"}, {'created': '2018-02-14 19:24:51.000000000', 'message': 'Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888
'}]
commit_message:
Fixing the filter in get MTU by network list query.

Based on the observation that a call to sync_routers can be slow
(10-15 seconds for one virtual router), and that profiling data show
that a significant amount of time is spent in function
_get_mtus_by_network_list, this change fixes incorrect the database
query for getting information about networks.

What changed:
- before: SQL query spent time O(#networks in database)
          (select all exists networks from database)
- after : SQL query spent time O(#network_ids passed to the function)
          (select only needed networks)

A basic test shows a drastic improvements, from 2 second to around
~0.2 second, in the processing of a _get_mtus_by_network_list call
with 300 networks in database.

Change-Id: Id50d1aaddd0d2a1110502de9c5b974063daa296a
Closes-Bug: #1748888

recheck

The good news is, you can actually create builders, add devices, rebalance, etc. under py3! The bad news is, py3 can't use builders that were created under py2, nor vice versa -- see bug 1644387. I *think* the rings themselves should load fine on both interpreters, though?"}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2016-11-24 01:24:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

From and initial look this look great. Want to test a little. Also when reading PREFIX and SUFFIX is in latin1, ring strings are in acsii and everything else is in utf-8.

I know why utf-8 and think I understand PREFIX and SUFFIX (from a discussion at a hackathon). But can we get some notes on why these decisions. I mean I totally believe they are required, and am sure you've done all the right things.. but just to make this easier to review for others, and to make it clear what we need for future patches/reviews in these areas, is there an etherpad or dev documentation somewhere?

If there is and it's obvious then, sorry my bad for not finding it :)"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2016-11-24 02:03:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified+1

commit_message:
py3: port common/ring/ and common/utils.py

I can't imagine us *not* having a py3 proxy server at some point, and
that proxy server is going to need a ring.

While we're at it (and since they were so close anyway), port

* cli/ringbuilder.py and
* common/linkat.py
* common/daemon.py

Change-Id: Iec8d97e0ce925614a86b516c4c6ed82809d0ba9b

However, I think we may wish to re-evaluate some of the tags. The way things are structured now we tend to think a lot about diverse affiliation and single vendorship when the thing that's most important is that the code is being produced in the open and has an open license. Obviously, we all know this, but what we measure impacts perception."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-15 13:47:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

@cdent: I totally agree. I'm not sure those tags are as useful as they were and might need to be revisited / adjusted. Added that topic to the TC list for the PTG."}, {'account_id': 8482, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:32:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-15 15:06:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

OK will approve this tomorrow unless new objections are posted.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-02-16 08:09:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]

commit_message:
Team diversity tags update, February 2018

* Congress no longer has diverse affiliation, due to only
  two core reviewers being active.

* Cyborg no longer has diverse affiliation, 88% of core reviews
  coming from Lenovo and Huawei.

* EC2API no longer is single-vendor, as its main developer is
  now independent.

* Glance no longer has diverse affiliation, 85% of core reviews
  coming from Red Hat and Verizon (55% for Red Hat alone).

* Masakari is single-vendor, with NTT doing 98% of core reviews.

* Monasca now has diverse affiliation, thanks to an increase in
  participation from HPE, OP5 and SUSE.

* Murano no longer has diverse affiliation, with 98% of core
  reviews coming from ZTE and AT&T.

* Qinling is single-vendor, with CatalystIT holding all core
  reviews.

* Senlin now has diverse affiliation, thanks to increased
  participation from AWCloud and Blizzard Entertainment.

* Solum is now single-vendor, with ZTE doing all core reviews.

* Storlets is now single-vendor, with NTT doing all core reviews.

* Tacker no longer has diverse affiliation, with 84% of core
  reviews coming from 99Cloud and NEC (64% from 99Cloud alone).

* Trove no longer is single-vendor, with increased participation
  from IBM, China Mobile, AWCloud and OVH.

Change-Id: I380b205e6958b4e042a435649f557be629ade06e

commit_message:
Change pool manager cache driver

This patchset changes the default pool manager cache driver used by
the designate charm from "memcached" to "sqlalchemy".

Change-Id: If61a28f572137b0e3041d17bd9296929074faf7d
Closes-Bug: #1739012

1. added juju-info interface dependency which was missing before this refactor (noticed failures when testing out-of-band on serverstack;

2. created a separate handler called render_config to make sure handlers are invoked in the following sequence after a config change: config_changed (sets config.complete) -> configure_domain_name (when config.complete) -> render_config (when config.complete and domain-name-configured);

3. modified unit tests to be more strict about the number of calls to set_flag and the fact that render_config should not be called in config_changed.'}, {'account_id': 24824, 'date': '2018-02-06 14:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

commit_message:
add support for ldaps and starttls via config opts

* Both ldaps and ldap + StartTLS require a CA certificate configuration
option;
* use_tls option should only be used for StartTLS and will result in an
error if used with a URL that starts with ldaps;
* if a certificate is specified then LDAP backend server's certificate
validation is considered mandatory ("demand" option).

Depends-On: Ied4b6ed64354e3de3c78e6ac809666ee9ae29d1a
Change-Id: I659683ffec91560ebbd77969840c27e3d7048689
Closes-Bug: #1728155

commit_message:
docker: configure group/user for deployment_user

Configure the deployment_user to be part of docker group, required for
openstack container commands.

Change-Id: Ifd1bec1262dfbd213810bb2b4d561f47bf010e69

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to tap-as-a-servire repo

Backport note: I removed the project name.  See [2]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126839.html

Change-Id: I5615d5b86fe51eba79536183cd8244475c84cc15
Needed-By: Id7bbd12a3250849c11860221524e650917247cec
(cherry picked from commit 39ec972694c48a4b0b52381ac53bded7824b4a94)

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to tap-as-a-servire repo

Backport note: I removed the project name.  See [2]

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-January/126839.html

Change-Id: I5615d5b86fe51eba79536183cd8244475c84cc15
Needed-By: Id7bbd12a3250849c11860221524e650917247cec
(cherry picked from commit 39ec972694c48a4b0b52381ac53bded7824b4a94)

commit_message:
VGPU: Modify the example of vgpu white_list set

`enabled_vgpu_types` flag has been set in nova.conf to set enabled
vgpu type of current host. The example is wrong.
Modify the example to avoid mislead.

Change-Id: If7a150d4d28609cabeb5f513bbd134a969fca17c
Closes-Bug: #1746217
(cherry picked from commit 8e687ab4f85561e31e4da06d89e9505179abc127)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 15:24:55.000000000', 'message': 'Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
(cherry picked from commit ea6757092df85b6cce38980ae5b7f54b76657e01)
'}]
commit_message:
Make bdms querying in multi-cell use scatter-gather and ignore down cell

This patch makes the querying of bdms from multiple cells in the
_get_instance_bdms_in_multiple_cells function of extended_volumes use
scatter_gather_cells thus making the process, parallel. It also adds
warnings in case a cell is not available; which the operator can later
tweak, if an exception needs to be raised. So for now, cells that are
not reachable are ignored and it proceeds to the next cell.

Change-Id: I0e05eb1e2ad37962968b79100bf4a96c7d6ddd8f
Closes-Bug: #1747650
(cherry picked from commit ea6757092df85b6cce38980ae5b7f54b76657e01)

[{'created': '2018-02-12 19:49:36.000000000', 'message': "Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be

(cherry picked from commit 0a7427dc58eeb271646a962604106e0e84b870b6)
"}]
commit_message:
Handle volume-backed instances in IsolatedHostsFilter

The RequestSpec.image object for a volume-backed instance will
not have the 'id' attribute set because the
nova.utils.get_image_metadata_from_volume() method doesn't convert
the volume['volume_image_metadata']['image_id'] into the ImageMeta.id
field. It is unclear if there are intentional reasons for omitting
this information, but the IsolatedHostsFilter has just never supported
filtering for volume-backed instances based on a provided image id.

The logic within the filter depends on the
restrict_isolated_hosts_to_isolated_images config option, which
defaults to True. When True, a volume-backed instance will not be
put on an isolated host. When False, a volume-backed instance can
go on any host, isolated or not.

Again, it's unclear if we should actually be filtering volume-backed
servers using the image_id from the volume_image_metadata or not,
but it's not what we've historically done so this change simply
fixes the regression bug.

Change-Id: Ieb8abb1a3f04ce008f9617e051e4d720dbe6917a
Closes-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 0a7427dc58eeb271646a962604106e0e84b870b6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-12 19:49:36.000000000', 'message': 'Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 4f9667b7a92ffef4329380e39c64cf314203b06e)
'}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for BFV+IsolatedHostsFilter failure

Creating a volume-backed server while using the IsolatedHostsFilter
results in a NoValidHost failure because the filter tries to load
the RequestSpec.image.id but when you create a server from a volume,
an image is not required directly in the server create request.

Change-Id: Id21e0afa5cec401555bee679193c256e55be863b
Related-Bug: #1746483
(cherry picked from commit 4f9667b7a92ffef4329380e39c64cf314203b06e)

subject: Small cleanup in DB replicator's error handling
messages: [{'account_id': 2622, 'date': '2018-02-16 00:06:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-02-16 00:08:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-16 00:06:12.000000000', 'message': 'Small cleanup in DB replicator's error handling

Generally, we shouldn't compare integers with "is". It happens to work
because (a) CPython has only one instance of each integer betwen -5
and 256, and (b) errno.ENOTEMPTY == 66 on Linux, but it's better not
to rely on those details.

Change-Id: I494a4adbb2bb35adcf83b2d23e790c1b220e75c7
'}]
commit_message:
Small cleanup in DB replicator's error handling

Generally, we shouldn't compare integers with "is". It happens to work
because (a) CPython has only one instance of each integer betwen -5
and 256, and (b) errno.ENOTEMPTY == 66 on Linux, but it's better not
to rely on those details.

Change-Id: I494a4adbb2bb35adcf83b2d23e790c1b220e75c7

commit_message:
Cinder: set ownership of co-ordination backend for backup service

This PS sets the ownership of the co-ordination backend location
when using the default file backend. This does not make the service
functional but prevents fatal errors when loading it.

docs.

commit_message:
Cleanup the manage-volumes admin doc

This was originaly copied over from "compute-manage-volumes.rst"
doc in the openstack-manuals repo but it's clearly mostly talking
about managing volumes on the Cinder side, not how they related
to compute server instances. Furthermore, Cinder already has a much
more detailed CLI guide on managing volumes, so this change removes
the content that's not specific to Nova and just links to the Cinder
docs.

Change-Id: I8e1c0d30debfdd4017c6d1a810a7b7dd382cd02d
(cherry picked from commit 9628d2a09445d67ccdb69ab7f57e59e6d33c2b6d)

commit_message:
Disallow mistralclient 3.2.0 to avoid bug

3.2.0 has a bug that causes TripleO and Congress experience auth
error when using mistralcient.

Needed for Queens release.  (needed in master too...)

See related bugs below for reference.

Change-Id: Iaf3dac1aaea2a05f302fc5c87174e4bbdd579291
Related-Bug: 1748751
Related-Bug: 1749186
Related-Bug: 1747800
Signed-off-by: Matthew Thode <mthode@mthode.org>

commit_message:
Add /volume to block-storage endpoint

The block-storage endpoint was added to the catalog, but in the suburl
case it was not added with the /volume suburl. This leads to find it and
attempting to use it but not being able to because it's mis-formed.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/545117
Change-Id: I84721c8ae637417e4b01be9e546ff77c250fc149

commit_message:
Make ContainerBroker.get_objects() args have defaults

Default the limit to CONTAINER_LISTING_LIMIT rather than
always requiring the caller to pass a value.

Also add default values for marker, end_marker etc.

Also add some unit tests for get_objects().

Change-Id: I77f5144e426a22ea56bdff1144209ad7a4cc59a9

commit_message:
Refactor token cache invalidation callbacks

There are several cases where we need to invalidate the token cache.
Notifications are used to do this and the token provider API uses
callbacks to subscribe to those notifications. This commit makes them
all use a single callback function instead of each defining their own
just to do the same thing. A subsequent patch will refactor the term
"persistence" from the notification names used across keystone.

Change-Id: I5e78f8aafec74e3edb952ab92947503c9be38b91

commit_message:
Remove needs_persistence property from token providers

Since the sql token storage mechanism was removed in Rocky, we no
longer need hooks in the token Manager to determine if a token needs
to be retrieved from or written to a backend somewhere. Instead, token
providers will need to handle storage requirements if they need them.
This will result in a cleaner token provider interface.

Change-Id: Icc095987d41e9c08de2f34dc657b08b98bd944e4

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/queens

The new stable upper-constraints file is only available
after the openstack/requirements repository is branched.
This will happen around the RC1 timeframe.

Recheck and merge this change once the requirements
repository has been branched.

The CI system will work with this patch before the requirements
repository is branched because zuul configues the job to run
with a local copy of the file and defaults to the master branch.
However, accepting the patch will break the test configuration
on developers' local systems, so please wait until after the
requirements repository is branched to merge the patch.

Change-Id: Ic627c7c332c6816891c2776e48138757d813df86

commit_message:
Use correct arguments in task inits

The CreateAndConnectCfgDrive and DeleteVOpt tasks were passing the
instance into the task.Task init as the first argument. The first arg
for the Task init is actually the task name [1]. This means that those
task names were string representations of the instance which will cause
failures if there are any non-ascii characters. This corrects the Task
init calls by removing instance as the first argument. The name kwarg
is now being used throughout the PowerVM tasks to avoid similar issues
in the future.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/taskflow/blob/3.1.0/taskflow/task.py#L62

Change-Id: I991a5ea33daa9a21f774fe24882ed40f990b8e0e
Closes-Bug: #1748950
(cherry picked from commit db686fe1856456e5e1486f0935aa4426c805520f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-15 17:06:16.000000000', 'message': "Don't JSON encode instance_info.traits for ironic

As of queens, the ironic virt driver pushes traits set on the flavor to
the ironic node's instance_info during instance spawn. This list of
traits is currently encoded as a JSON string, inside the JSON-encoded
instance_info. We should not use this double layer of JSON encoding, as
ironic expects instance_info.traits to be a list.

This change removes the nested JSON encoding when setting
node.instance_info.traits.

Change-Id: I1f3f96f7ef310022accde67cab1ae415bbc3c292
Closes-Bug: #1748942
(cherry picked from commit 54713a834f2a0e5b55b8f77c601ff35eb74b9b09)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't JSON encode instance_info.traits for ironic

As of queens, the ironic virt driver pushes traits set on the flavor to
the ironic node's instance_info during instance spawn. This list of
traits is currently encoded as a JSON string, inside the JSON-encoded
instance_info. We should not use this double layer of JSON encoding, as
ironic expects instance_info.traits to be a list.

This change removes the nested JSON encoding when setting
node.instance_info.traits.

Change-Id: I1f3f96f7ef310022accde67cab1ae415bbc3c292
Closes-Bug: #1748942
(cherry picked from commit 54713a834f2a0e5b55b8f77c601ff35eb74b9b09)

This is a minor version bump for
9adf97c0132c3e0d34bbb2e33b59c6e5b00bec57 which
adds an optional db schema migration. The minor
version bump is an indication to deployment tooling
that they should run the db schema migrations (even
though those are free and tooling should be running
them on upgrade regardless, but I digress).

Change-Id: I0c4d2dfc306d711b1f649d94782e8ae40475c43f
'}]
commit_message:
nova: release pike 16.1.0

This is a minor version bump for
9adf97c0132c3e0d34bbb2e33b59c6e5b00bec57 which
adds an optional db schema migration. The minor
version bump is an indication to deployment tooling
that they should run the db schema migrations (even
though those are free and tooling should be running
them on upgrade regardless, but I digress).

Change-Id: I0c4d2dfc306d711b1f649d94782e8ae40475c43f

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

Change-Id: Ic1dd5a53011e56e3673cf11f878e0de07a4877df
